 70	suspend fun getLastRefreshTimeString(context: Context): String? {
 71	 return context.dataStore.data
 72	 .map { preferences ->
 73	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY]
 74	 }
 75	 .firstOrNull()
 76	}
 77	
 78	suspend fun getLastScrapeResult(context: Context): List<DreamParkEvent>? {
 79	 val jsonString = context.dreamParkDataStore.data
 80	 .map { preferences ->
 81	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY]
 82	 }
 83	 .firstOrNull()
 84	
 85	 return jsonString?.let {
 86	 try {
 87	 val parser = Parser.default()
 88	 val stringBuilder = StringBuilder(it)
 89	 val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>
 90	
 91	 json?.mapNotNull { item ->
 92	 (item as? JsonObject)?.let { jsonObject ->
 93	 val eventMap = jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }
 94	 DreamParkEvent(
 95	 title = eventMap["title"] ?: "Unknown Event",
 96	 date = eventMap["dateOnly"] ?: "Date TBD",
 97	 link = eventMap["link"] ?: ""
 98	 )
 99	 }
 100	 }
 101	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 102	 null
 103	 }
 104	 }
 105	}
 106	
 107	
 108	val Context.dataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "lastRefresh")
 109	val LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY = stringPreferencesKey("last_refresh_time")
 110	
 111	val Context.dreamParkDataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "dreamParkData")
 112	val LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY = stringPreferencesKey("last_scrape_result")
 113	
 114	
 115	@OptIn(ExperimentalMaterial3Api::class)
 116	@Composable
 117	fun ListViewScreen(navController: NavController, context: MainActivity) {
 118	 val localContext = LocalContext.current
 119	 var dreamParkEvents by remember { mutableStateOf<List<DreamParkEvent>>(emptyList()) }
 120	 var isLoading by remember { mutableStateOf(true) } // Start as true
 121	 var errorMessage by remember { mutableStateOf<String?>(null) }
 122	 var lastRefreshTime by remember { mutableStateOf<String?>(null) }
 123	 var refreshTrigger by remember { mutableStateOf(0) }
 124	
 125	 fun forceRefresh() {
 126	 refreshTrigger++
 127	 }
 128	
 129	 LaunchedEffect(refreshTrigger) { // Triggers on initial load and manual refresh
 130	 isLoading = true
 131	 errorMessage = null // Reset error message at the start of a load
 132	
 133	 try {
 134	 val lastRefreshTimeStr = getLastRefreshTimeString(localContext)
 135	 lastRefreshTime = lastRefreshTimeStr
 136	
 137	 val needsFreshScrape: Boolean
 138	 val lastRefreshMillis = lastRefreshTimeStr?.toLongOrNull()
 139	 // Using a shorter duration for easier testing of refresh logic if needed, e.g., 1 minute
 140	 // val oneWeekInMillis = 1 * 60 * 1000L // 1 minute for testing
 141	 val oneWeekInMillis = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000L // 7 days
 142	
 143	 // Force fresh scrape if this is a manual refresh (refreshTrigger > 0)
 144	 if (refreshTrigger > 0) {
 145	 needsFreshScrape = true
 146	 } else if (lastRefreshMillis == null) {
 147	 needsFreshScrape = true
 148	 } else {
 149	 val timeSinceLastRefresh = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastRefreshMillis
 150	 needsFreshScrape = timeSinceLastRefresh >= oneWeekInMillis
 151	 }
 152	
 153	 var loadedFromCache = false // Reset this flag
 154	 val cachedScrapeResult = getLastScrapeResult(localContext) // Uses Klaxon
 155	
 156	 if (needsFreshScrape || cachedScrapeResult == null) { // Modified condition: always scrape if cache is null
 157	 try {
 158	 println(" UI: Starting fresh scrape...")
 159	 val scrapeStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 160	
 161	 val scrapedEvents: List<DreamParkEvent> = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 162	 scrapeDreamParkEvents(localContext)
 163	 }
 164	 val scrapeTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 165	 println(" UI: Scraping completed in ${scrapeTime}ms")
 166	
 167	 dreamParkEvents = scrapedEvents
 168	 errorMessage = null // Clear error if scrape is successful
 169	
 170	 val cacheStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 171	 withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 172	 val currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis().toString()
 173	 localContext.dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 174	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY] = currentTime
 175	 }
 176	
 177	 println(" UI: Starting JSON serialization of ${scrapedEvents.size} events...")
 178	 val jsonStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 179	 // Convert back to map format for JSON serialization
 180	 val eventsForJson = scrapedEvents.map { event ->
 181	 mapOf(
 182	 "title" to event.title,
 183	 "dateOnly" to event.date,
 184	 "link" to event.link
 185	 )
 186	 }
 187	 val jsonScrapedEvents = Klaxon().toJsonString(eventsForJson)
 188	 val jsonTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - jsonStartTime
 189	 println(" UI: JSON serialization completed in ${jsonTime}ms")
 190	
 191	 localContext.dreamParkDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 192	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY] = jsonScrapedEvents
 193	 }
 194	 lastRefreshTime = currentTime // Update UI state for last refresh time
 195	 }
 196	 val cacheTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - cacheStartTime
 197	 println(" UI: Caching completed in ${cacheTime}ms")
 198	
 199	 val totalRefreshTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 200	 println(" UI: TOTAL REFRESH TIME: ${totalRefreshTime}ms (${totalRefreshTime/1000.0}s)")
 201	 println(" UI Performance breakdown:")
 202	 println(" - Web scraping: ${scrapeTime}ms (${(scrapeTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 203	 println(" - Caching (JSON + DataStore): ${cacheTime}ms (${(cacheTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 204	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 205	 errorMessage = "Failed to load fresh events: ${e.message}"
 206	 if (cachedScrapeResult != null) {
 207	 dreamParkEvents = cachedScrapeResult
 208	 loadedFromCache = true
 209	 errorMessage = "Showing older data. Failed to refresh: ${e.message}"
 210	 } else {
 211	 errorMessage = "Failed to load events and no cached data available: ${e.message}"
 212	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList() // Ensure events list is empty
 213	 }
 214	 }
 215	 } else { // This else means: needsFreshScrape is false AND cachedScrapeResult is NOT null
 216	 dreamParkEvents = cachedScrapeResult
 217	 loadedFromCache = true
 218	 // Optionally clear error if successfully loaded from cache
 219	 // errorMessage = null
 220	 }
 221	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 222	 // This is a global catch block for any unhandled exceptions in the LaunchedEffect's try block.
 223	 errorMessage = "An critical error occurred: ${e.message}"
 224	 if (dreamParkEvents.isEmpty()) { // If events are still empty, try to load from cache one last time
 225	 val fallbackCache = getLastScrapeResult(localContext)
 226	 if (fallbackCache != null) {
 227	 dreamParkEvents = fallbackCache
 228	 errorMessage += " Displaying cached data if possible."
 229	 } else {
 230	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList()
 231	 }
 232	 }
 233	 } finally {
 234	 isLoading = false
 235	 }
 236	 }
 237	
 238	 Scaffold(
 239	 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxSize(),
 240	 topBar = {
 241	 LargeTopAppBar(
 242	 title = {
 243	 Text(
 244	 text = "Equine Events",
 245	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.headlineMedium
 246	 )
 247	 },
 248	 actions = {
 249	 IconButton(
 250	 onClick = { forceRefresh() },
 251	 enabled = !isLoading
 252	 ) {
 253	 Icon(
 254	 imageVector = Icons.Default.Refresh,
 255	 contentDescription = "Refresh events"
 256	 )
 257	 }
 258	 },
 259	 colors = TopAppBarDefaults.largeTopAppBarColors(
 260	 containerColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.surface,
 261	 titleContentColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurface
 262	 )
 263	 )
 264	 }
 265	 ) { innerPadding ->
 266	 when {
 267	 isLoading -> {
 268	 Box(
 269	 modifier = Modifier
 270	 .fillMaxSize()
 271	 .padding(innerPadding),
 272	 contentAlignment = Alignment.Center
 273	 ) {
 274	 Column(
 275	 horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally,
 276	 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.Center
 277	 ) {
 278	 CircularProgressIndicator(
 279	 modifier = Modifier.size(48.dp),
 280	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 281	 strokeWidth = 4.dp
 282	 )
 283	 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(16.dp))
 284	 Text(
 285	 text = "Loading events...",
 286	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyLarge,
 287	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant
 288	 )
 289	 }
 290	 }
 291	 }

 - `DreamParkWebScraper.kt` - Updated package and imports
 - `ListViewScreen.kt` - Updated package and imports
 - `DreamParkEvent.kt` - Moved to data package with correct imports

3. **Configuration Files Updated:**
 - `build.gradle.kts` - Already had correct namespace and applicationId
 - `AndroidManifest.xml` - Updated theme references
 - `themes.xml` - Updated theme name from `Theme.JetPackComposeFirstProject` to `Theme.EquineEvents`
 - `strings.xml` - Already had "Equine Events" as app name

4. **Performance Optimizations Maintained:**
 - All LazyColumn performance improvements are preserved
 - Stable keys and content types maintained
 - Data class structure with optimized key generation
 - Memoized click handlers

The build was successful. I've successfully converted your LazyColumn to a regular Column with proper scrolling. Here's what I changed:

## **Conversion Summary**

**Before (LazyColumn syntax mixed with Column):**
```kotlin
Column(
 modifier = Modifier
 .fillMaxSize()
 .verticalScroll(scrollState)
 .padding(innerPadding),
 contentPadding = PaddingValues(16.dp), // LazyColumn property
 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(12.dp)
) {
 items( // LazyColumn function
 items = dreamParkEvents,
 key = { event -> event.key },
 contentType = { "event_card" }
 ) { dreamParkEvent ->
 EventCard(
 event = dreamParkEvent,
 onEventClick = onEventClick
 )
 }
}
```

**After (Proper Column syntax):**
```kotlin
Column(
 modifier = Modifier
 .fillMaxSize()
 .verticalScroll(scrollState)
 .padding(innerPadding)
 .padding(16.dp), // Moved padding to modifier
 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(12.dp)
) {
 dreamParkEvents.forEach { dreamParkEvent -> // Standard forEach loop
 EventCard(
 event = dreamParkEvent,
 onEventClick = onEventClick
 )
 }
}
```

## **Key Changes Made**

1. **Removed LazyColumn-specific properties:**
 - `contentPadding = PaddingValues(16.dp)` 
 - `.padding(16.dp)` added to modifier chain

2. **Replaced LazyColumn `items()` function:**
 - `items(items = dreamParkEvents, key = {...}, contentType = {...})`
 - `dreamParkEvents.forEach { dreamParkEvent -> ... }`

3. **Maintained scrolling functionality:**
 - `verticalScroll(scrollState)` remains in modifier
 - `rememberScrollState()` already defined in the composable
 - Proper imports already in place

## **Important Notes**

- **Performance:** Column renders all items at once (no lazy loading), so it's suitable for smaller lists
- **Scrolling:** Uses `verticalScroll()` for manual scrolling instead of LazyColumn's built-in scrolling
- **Spacing:** `Arrangement.spacedBy(12.dp)` maintains the same 12dp spacing between items
- **Build:** Compiles successfully with no errors

The conversion is complete and your app will now use a regular scrollable Column instead of a LazyColumn!

The build was successful. I've successfully converted your LazyColumn to a regular Column with proper scrolling. Here's what I changed:

## **Conversion Summary**

**Before (LazyColumn syntax mixed with Column):**
```kotlin
Column(
 modifier = Modifier
 .fillMaxSize()
 .verticalScroll(scrollState)
 .padding(innerPadding),
 contentPadding = PaddingValues(16.dp), // LazyColumn property
 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(12.dp)
) {
 items( // LazyColumn function
 items = dreamParkEvents,
 key = { event -> event.key },
 contentType = { "event_card" }
 ) { dreamParkEvent ->
 EventCard(
 event = dreamParkEvent,
 onEventClick = onEventClick
 )
 }
}
```

**After (Proper Column syntax):**
```kotlin
Column(
 modifier = Modifier
 .fillMaxSize()
 .verticalScroll(scrollState)
 .padding(innerPadding)
 .padding(16.dp), // Moved padding to modifier
 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.spacedBy(12.dp)
) {
 dreamParkEvents.forEach { dreamParkEvent -> // Standard forEach loop
 EventCard(
 event = dreamParkEvent,
 onEventClick = onEventClick
 )
 }
}
```

## **Key Changes Made**

1. **Removed LazyColumn-specific properties:**
 - `contentPadding = PaddingValues(16.dp)` 
 - `.padding(16.dp)` added to modifier chain

2. **Replaced LazyColumn `items()` function:**
 - `items(items = dreamParkEvents, key = {...}, contentType = {...})`
 - `dreamParkEvents.forEach { dreamParkEvent -> ... }`

3. **Maintained scrolling functionality:**
 - `verticalScroll(scrollState)` remains in modifier
 - `rememberScrollState()` already defined in the composable
 - Proper imports already in place

## **Important Notes**

- **Performance:** Column renders all items at once (no lazy loading), so it's suitable for smaller lists
- **Scrolling:** Uses `verticalScroll()` for manual scrolling instead of LazyColumn's built-in scrolling
- **Spacing:** `Arrangement.spacedBy(12.dp)` maintains the same 12dp spacing between items
- **Build:** Compiles successfully with no errors

The conversion is complete and your app will now use a regular scrollable Column instead of a LazyColumn!

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/StarredEventsManager.kt", "file_content": "package com.calvinsteck.equineevents.data\n\nimport android.content.Context\nimport androidx.datastore.core.DataStore\nimport androidx.datastore.preferences.core.Preferences\nimport androidx.datastore.preferences.core.edit\nimport androidx.datastore.preferences.core.stringSetPreferencesKey\nimport androidx.datastore.preferences.preferencesDataStore\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.flow.firstOrNull\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.flow.map\n\n// DataStore for starred events\nval Context.starredEventsDataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = \"starredEvents\")\nval STARRED_EVENTS_KEY = stringSetPreferencesKey(\"starred_event_ids\")\n\nclass StarredEventsManager(private val context: Context) {\n \n // Get all starred event IDs\n suspend fun getStarredEventIds(): Set<String> {\n return context.starredEventsDataStore.data\n .map { preferences ->\n preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] ?: emptySet()\n }\n .firstOrNull() ?: emptySet()\n }\n \n // Add an event to starred list\n suspend fun starEvent(eventId: String) {\n context.starredEventsDataStore.edit { preferences ->\n val currentStarred = preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] ?: emptySet()\n preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] = currentStarred + eventId\n }\n }\n \n // Remove an event from starred list\n suspend fun unstarEvent(eventId: String) {\n context.starredEventsDataStore.edit { preferences ->\n val currentStarred = preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] ?: emptySet()\n preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] = currentStarred - eventId\n }\n }\n \n // Toggle starred status of an event\n suspend fun toggleEventStar(eventId: String): Boolean {\n val currentStarred = getStarredEventIds()\n return if (eventId in currentStarred) {\n unstarEvent(eventId)\n false // Now unstarred\n } else {\n starEvent(eventId)\n true // Now starred\n }\n }\n \n // Apply starred status to a list of events\n suspend fun applyStarredStatus(events: List<DreamParkEvent>): List<DreamParkEvent> {\n val starredIds = getStarredEventIds()\n return events.map { event ->\n event.copy(isStarred = event.uniqueId in starredIds)\n }\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"### Step 2: Create a StarredEventsManager for persistent storage

## **Starring Feature Implementation Complete**

I've successfully added a comprehensive starring system to your Equine Events app. Here's what was implemented:

### **Key Features Added**

1. **Persistent Starring Storage**
 - Uses DataStore to save starred event IDs
 - Starred status persists across app restarts, refreshes, and new event additions

2. **Updated Data Model**
 - `DreamParkEvent` now includes `isStarred: Boolean` property
 - Added `uniqueId` for reliable event identification across refreshes

3. **Star Management System**
 - `StarredEventsManager` handles all starring operations
 - Toggle, star, unstar, and apply starred status to event lists

4. **Enhanced UI**
 - Star/unstar button in each event card
 - Visual feedback: filled star () for starred, outline star () for unstarred
 - Immediate UI updates when toggling stars

### **Technical Implementation**

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
data class DreamParkEvent(
 val title: String,
 val date: String,
 val link: String,
 val isStarred: Boolean = false
) {
 val uniqueId: String by lazy { "${title}_${date}_${link}".hashCode().toString() }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The build is successful. Now let me create a summary of the starring feature I've implemented:

## **Starring Feature Implementation Complete**

I've successfully added a comprehensive starring system to your Equine Events app. Here's what was implemented:

### **Key Features Added**

1. **Persistent Starring Storage**
 - Uses DataStore to save starred event IDs
 - Starred status persists across app restarts, refreshes, and new event additions

2. **Updated Data Model**
 - `DreamParkEvent` now includes `isStarred: Boolean` property
 - Added `uniqueId` for reliable event identification across refreshes

3. **Star Management System**
 - `StarredEventsManager` handles all starring operations
 - Toggle, star, unstar, and apply starred status to event lists

4. **Enhanced UI**
 - Star/unstar button in each event card
 - Visual feedback: filled star () for starred, outline star () for unstarred
 - Immediate UI updates when toggling stars

### **Technical Implementation**

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt mode=EXCERPT
data class DreamParkEvent(
 val title: String,
 val date: String,
 val link: String,
 val isStarred: Boolean = false
) {
 val uniqueId: String by lazy { "${title}_${date}_${link}".hashCode().toString() }
}
````

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/StarredEventsManager.kt mode=EXCERPT
class StarredEventsManager(private val context: Context) {
 suspend fun toggleEventStar(eventId: String): Boolean
 suspend fun applyStarredStatus(events: List<DreamParkEvent>): List<DreamParkEvent>
 // ... other methods
}
````

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt mode=EXCERPT
// Star button in EventCard
IconButton(
 onClick = { onStarClick(event) }
) {
 Icon(
 imageVector = if (event.isStarred) Icons.Filled.Star else Icons.Outlined.StarBorder,
 tint = if (event.isStarred) MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary else MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant
 )
}
````

### **User Experience**

- **Tap the star icon** to star/unstar any event
- **Starred events show a filled star** () in primary color
- **Unstarred events show an outline star** () in muted color
- **Starred status persists** when:
 - App is restarted
 - Events are refreshed
 - New events are added from the website
 - App data is cached/restored

### **Data Flow**

1. **Event Loading**: All event lists (fresh scrapes, cached data, fallback data) automatically get starred status applied
2. **Star Toggle**: Immediate UI update + background persistence to DataStore
3. **Event Identification**: Uses `uniqueId` based on title, date, and link to reliably match events across refreshes

The starring feature is now fully functional and ready to use! Users can star their favorite events and the starred status will be maintained across all app sessions and data refreshes.

The build was successful. I've significantly improved the EventCard component with better visual design and user experience. Here's what I changed:

## **EventCard Improvements**

### **Enhanced Star Button**
- **Larger size**: Increased from 20dp icon in 32dp button **28dp icon in 48dp button**
- **Better positioning**: Moved to top-right corner for prominent placement
- **Improved visual feedback**: 
 - Starred: Full opacity primary color
 - Unstarred: 70% opacity for subtle appearance

### **Better Layout & Visual Hierarchy**

**Before (cramped layout):**
```
[Event Icon] [Title + Date] [Star][Link Icon]
```

**After (improved spacing):**
```
[Event Icon] [Title + Date] [Large Star]

 [View Details ]
```

### **Key Improvements**

1. **Separated Actions**: Star and link actions are now in different areas
 - **Star**: Top-right corner (primary action)
 - **Link**: Bottom-right with "View Details" label (secondary action)

2. **Clearer Visual Hierarchy**:
 - Star button is now the most prominent interactive element
 - Link action is more descriptive with "View Details" text
 - Better spacing prevents accidental taps

3. **Enhanced Accessibility**:
 - Larger touch targets (48dp star button)
 - Clear visual separation between actions
 - Descriptive text for the link action

### **User Experience Benefits**

- **Easier starring**: Much larger, more prominent star button
- **No confusion**: Star and link actions are visually separated
- **Better touch targets**: 48dp star button meets accessibility guidelines
- **Clearer intent**: "View Details" text makes the link action obvious

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
// Prominent star button in top-right
IconButton(
 onClick = { onStarClick(event) },
 modifier = Modifier.size(48.dp)
) {
 Icon(
 imageVector = if (event.isStarred) Icons.Filled.Star else Icons.Outlined.StarBorder,
 modifier = Modifier.size(28.dp),
 tint = if (event.isStarred) {
 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 } else {
 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant.copy(alpha = 0.7f)
 }
 )
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The EventCard now provides a much better user experience with a prominent, easy-to-tap star button and clear visual separation between different actions!

The build was successful. I've significantly improved the EventCard component with better visual design and user experience. Here's what I changed:

## **EventCard Improvements**

### **Enhanced Star Button**
- **Larger size**: Increased from 20dp icon in 32dp button **28dp icon in 48dp button**
- **Better positioning**: Moved to top-right corner for prominent placement
- **Improved visual feedback**: 
 - Starred: Full opacity primary color
 - Unstarred: 70% opacity for subtle appearance

### **Better Layout & Visual Hierarchy**

**Before (cramped layout):**
```
[Event Icon] [Title + Date] [Star][Link Icon]
```

**After (improved spacing):**
```
[Event Icon] [Title + Date] [Large Star]

 [View Details ]
```

### **Key Improvements**

1. **Separated Actions**: Star and link actions are now in different areas
 - **Star**: Top-right corner (primary action)
 - **Link**: Bottom-right with "View Details" label (secondary action)

2. **Clearer Visual Hierarchy**:
 - Star button is now the most prominent interactive element
 - Link action is more descriptive with "View Details" text
 - Better spacing prevents accidental taps

3. **Enhanced Accessibility**:
 - Larger touch targets (48dp star button)
 - Clear visual separation between actions
 - Descriptive text for the link action

### **User Experience Benefits**

- **Easier starring**: Much larger, more prominent star button
- **No confusion**: Star and link actions are visually separated
- **Better touch targets**: 48dp star button meets accessibility guidelines
- **Clearer intent**: "View Details" text makes the link action obvious

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt mode=EXCERPT
// Prominent star button in top-right
IconButton(
 onClick = { onStarClick(event) },
 modifier = Modifier.size(48.dp)
) {
 Icon(
 imageVector = if (event.isStarred) Icons.Filled.Star else Icons.Outlined.StarBorder,
 modifier = Modifier.size(28.dp),
 tint = if (event.isStarred) {
 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 } else {
 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant.copy(alpha = 0.7f)
 }
 )
}
````

The EventCard now provides a much better user experience with a prominent, easy-to-tap star button and clear visual separation between different actions!

## **Layout Improvement**

**Before (View Details below content):**
```
[Event Icon] [Title] [Large Star]
 [ Date]

 [View Details ]
```

**After (View Details aligned with date):**
```
[Event Icon] [Title] [Large Star]
 [ Date] [View Details ]
```

### **Key Changes**

1. **Better Space Utilization**: The "View Details" button now uses the available horizontal space next to the date
2. **More Compact Layout**: Eliminates the extra vertical space that was created by the separate row
3. **Improved Visual Balance**: All content is now contained within the main content area
4. **Better Alignment**: The "View Details" action is positioned at the same level as the date information

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
Row(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.SpaceBetween,
 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically
) {
 Row(/* Date with calendar icon */) { ... }
 
 // View Details button aligned with date
 if (event.link.isNotEmpty()) {
 Row(/* View Details button */) { ... }
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The EventCard now has a more compact and balanced layout with the "View Details" button positioned inline with the date, making better use of the available space!

The build was successful. I've moved the "View Details" button to the right edge, positioned below the star button in a vertical column layout.

## **Layout Update Complete**

**New Layout:**
```
[Event Icon] [Title] [Large Star]
 [ Date] [View Details ]
```

### **Key Changes**

1. **Right Edge Column**: Created a `Column` on the right edge that contains both the star button and "View Details" button
2. **Vertical Stacking**: The "View Details" button is now positioned directly below the star button
3. **Edge Alignment**: Both buttons are aligned to the right edge of the card, creating a clean vertical action column
4. **Consistent Positioning**: Both interactive elements are now grouped together on the right side

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
// Right edge actions column
Column(
 horizontalAlignment = Alignment.End
) {
 // Prominent star button
 IconButton(onClick = { onStarClick(event) }) { ... }
 
 // View Details button on the edge
 if (event.link.isNotEmpty()) {
 Row(/* View Details content */) { ... }
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

### **Benefits**

- **Clear Action Area**: All interactive elements are grouped on the right edge
- **Better Visual Hierarchy**: Star button (primary action) is above, "View Details" (secondary action) is below
- **Consistent Edge Alignment**: Both buttons follow the same right-edge positioning
- **Clean Layout**: The main content (title and date) has more space on the left

The EventCard now has a well-organized right edge with both the star and "View Details" buttons positioned consistently!

## **Layout Update Complete**

**New Layout:**
```
[Event Icon] [Title] [Large Star]
 [ Date] [View Details ]
```

### **Key Changes**

1. **Horizontal Alignment**: The "View Details" button is now inline with the date, creating a balanced horizontal layout
2. **SpaceBetween Layout**: Used `Arrangement.SpaceBetween` to position the date on the left and "View Details" on the right
3. **Clean Separation**: The star button remains in the top-right corner, while the "View Details" action is contextually placed with the date information
4. **Better Visual Flow**: The layout now flows more naturally with related information grouped together

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
Row(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.SpaceBetween,
 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically
) {
 Row(/* Date with calendar icon */) { ... }
 
 // View Details button inline with date
 if (event.link.isNotEmpty()) {
 Row(/* View Details content */) { ... }
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

### **Benefits**

- **Better Balance**: The date and "View Details" are now on the same horizontal level
- **Clear Hierarchy**: Star button (primary action) is prominent in top-right, "View Details" (secondary action) is contextually placed with date
- **Efficient Space Usage**: Makes better use of the horizontal space in the date row
- **Logical Grouping**: Date and link action are related and now visually connected

The EventCard now has an optimal layout with the star button prominently positioned in the top-right and the "View Details" button logically placed inline with the date information!

The build was successful. I've moved the "View Details" button down so it's now horizontally aligned with the date row.

## **Layout Update Complete**

**New Layout:**
```
[Event Icon] [Title] [Large Star]
 [ Date] [View Details ]
```

### **Key Changes**

1. **Horizontal Alignment**: The "View Details" button is now inline with the date, creating a balanced horizontal layout
2. **SpaceBetween Layout**: Used `Arrangement.SpaceBetween` to position the date on the left and "View Details" on the right
3. **Clean Separation**: The star button remains in the top-right corner, while the "View Details" action is contextually placed with the date information
4. **Better Visual Flow**: The layout now flows more naturally with related information grouped together

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt mode=EXCERPT
Row(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.SpaceBetween,
 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically
) {
 Row(/* Date with calendar icon */) { ... }
 
 // View Details button inline with date
 if (event.link.isNotEmpty()) {
 Row(/* View Details content */) { ... }
 }
}
````

### **Benefits**

- **Better Balance**: The date and "View Details" are now on the same horizontal level
- **Clear Hierarchy**: Star button (primary action) is prominent in top-right, "View Details" (secondary action) is contextually placed with date
- **Efficient Space Usage**: Makes better use of the horizontal space in the date row
- **Logical Grouping**: Date and link action are related and now visually connected

The EventCard now has an optimal layout with the star button prominently positioned in the top-right and the "View Details" button logically placed inline with the date information!

```
 [ Date] [View Details ]
```

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt" mode="EXCERPT">

```kotlin
 horizontalAlignment = Alignment.End
) {

 IconButton(onClick = { onStarClick(event) }) { ... }

 if (event.link.isNotEmpty()) {
 Row(

 ) { /* View Details content */ }
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

### **Perfect Balance**

- **Star Button**: Top-right corner (primary action)
- **View Details**: Right edge, vertically aligned with date (secondary action)
- **Date**: Left side with calendar icon
- **Title**: Full width above the date

## **Enhanced Date System Implementation Complete**

I've successfully upgraded your app to handle proper date parsing with start/end dates and enhanced display formatting. Here's what was implemented:

### **Key Features Added**

1. **Structured Date Parsing**
 - Parses date strings like "March 15" or "March 15 - March 17"
 - Handles cross-month ranges like "March 30 - April 2"
 - Assumes current year when no year is specified
 - Stores both start and end dates as `LocalDate` objects

2. **Enhanced Display Format**
 - Shows day of the week before the date
 - Format: "Wednesday, March 15" or "Wednesday, March 15 - Friday, March 17"
 - Automatically handles single-day vs multi-day events

3. **Robust Date Parsing**
 - Supports various month name formats (full names, abbreviations)
 - Graceful fallback to current date if parsing fails
 - Case-insensitive parsing

### **Technical Implementation**

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
data class DreamParkEvent(
 val title: String,
 val rawDateString: String, // Original scraped date string
 val startDate: LocalDate,
 val endDate: LocalDate?, // null if single day event
 val link: String,
 val isStarred: Boolean = false
) {
 // Format date for display with day of week
 val formattedDateString: String by lazy {
 val dayOfWeek = startDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 val formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM d")
 
 if (endDate != null && endDate != startDate) {
 val endDayOfWeek = endDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)} - $endDayOfWeek, ${endDate.format(endFormatter)}"
 } else {
 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)}"
 }
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
object EventDateParser {
 fun parseDateString(dateString: String): Pair<LocalDate, LocalDate?> {
 // Handles formats like:
 // - "March 15" (single day)
 // - "March 15 - March 17" (date range)
 // - "March 15 - April 2" (cross-month range)
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

### **User Experience Improvements**

**Before:**
```
 March 15 - March 17
```

**After:**
```
 Wednesday, March 15 - Friday, March 17
```

### **Data Flow**

1. **Web Scraping**: Raw date strings are parsed into structured `LocalDate` objects
2. **Storage**: Original raw strings are preserved for JSON serialization
3. **Display**: Formatted strings with day-of-week are generated on-demand
4. **Caching**: All date parsing works seamlessly with existing cache system

### **Supported Date Formats**

- **Single Day**: "March 15" "Wednesday, March 15"
- **Date Range**: "March 15 - March 17" "Wednesday, March 15 - Friday, March 17"
- **Cross-Month**: "March 30 - April 2" "Saturday, March 30 - Tuesday, April 2"
- **Month Abbreviations**: "Mar 15", "Apr 2", etc.
- **Current Year**: Automatically assumes current year when not specified

The enhanced date system now provides much richer date information while maintaining backward compatibility with your existing caching and starring systems!

 69	suspend fun getLastRefreshTimeString(context: Context): String? {
 70	 return context.dataStore.data
 71	 .map { preferences ->
 72	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY]
 73	 }
 74	 .firstOrNull()
 75	}
 76	
 77	suspend fun getLastScrapeResult(context: Context): List<Map<String, String>>? {
 78	 val jsonString = context.dreamParkDataStore.data
 79	 .map { preferences ->
 80	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY]
 81	 }
 82	 .firstOrNull()
 83	
 84	 return jsonString?.let {
 85	 try {
 86	 val parser = Parser.default()
 87	 val stringBuilder = StringBuilder(it)
 88	 val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>
 89	
 90	 json?.mapNotNull { item ->
 91	 (item as? JsonObject)?.let { jsonObject ->
 92	 jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }
 93	 }
 94	 }
 95	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 96	 null
 97	 }
 98	 }
 99	}

 101	
 102	val Context.dataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "lastRefresh")
 103	val LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY = stringPreferencesKey("last_refresh_time")
 104	
 105	val Context.dreamParkDataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "dreamParkData")
 106	val LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY = stringPreferencesKey("last_scrape_result")
 107

 109	@OptIn(ExperimentalMaterial3Api::class)
 110	@Composable
 111	fun ListViewScreen(navController: NavController, context: MainActivity) {
 112	 val localContext = LocalContext.current
 113	 var dreamParkEvents by remember { mutableStateOf<List<Map<String, String>>>(emptyList()) }
 114	 var isLoading by remember { mutableStateOf(true) } // Start as true
 115	 var errorMessage by remember { mutableStateOf<String?>(null) }
 116	 var lastRefreshTime by remember { mutableStateOf<String?>(null) }
 117	 var refreshTrigger by remember { mutableStateOf(0) }
 118	
 119	 fun forceRefresh() {
 120	 refreshTrigger++
 121	 }
 122	
 123	 LaunchedEffect(refreshTrigger) { // Triggers on initial load and manual refresh
 124	 isLoading = true
 125	 errorMessage = null // Reset error message at the start of a load
 126	
 127	 try {
 128	 val lastRefreshTimeStr = getLastRefreshTimeString(localContext)
 129	 lastRefreshTime = lastRefreshTimeStr
 130	
 131	 val needsFreshScrape: Boolean
 132	 val lastRefreshMillis = lastRefreshTimeStr?.toLongOrNull()
 133	 // Using a shorter duration for easier testing of refresh logic if needed, e.g., 1 minute
 134	 // val oneWeekInMillis = 1 * 60 * 1000L // 1 minute for testing
 135	 val oneWeekInMillis = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000L // 7 days
 136	
 137	 // Force fresh scrape if this is a manual refresh (refreshTrigger > 0)
 138	 if (refreshTrigger > 0) {
 139	 needsFreshScrape = true
 140	 } else if (lastRefreshMillis == null) {
 141	 needsFreshScrape = true
 142	 } else {
 143	 val timeSinceLastRefresh = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastRefreshMillis
 144	 needsFreshScrape = timeSinceLastRefresh >= oneWeekInMillis
 145	 }
 146	
 147	 var loadedFromCache = false // Reset this flag
 148	 val cachedScrapeResult = getLastScrapeResult(localContext) // Uses Klaxon
 149	
 150	 if (needsFreshScrape || cachedScrapeResult == null) { // Modified condition: always scrape if cache is null
 151	 try {
 152	 println(" UI: Starting fresh scrape...")
 153	 val scrapeStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 154	
 155	 val scrapedEvents: List<Map<String, String>> = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 156	 scrapeDreamParkEvents(localContext)
 157	 }
 158	 val scrapeTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 159	 println(" UI: Scraping completed in ${scrapeTime}ms")
 160	
 161	 dreamParkEvents = scrapedEvents
 162	 errorMessage = null // Clear error if scrape is successful
 163	
 164	 val cacheStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 165	 withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 166	 val currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis().toString()
 167	 localContext.dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 168	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY] = currentTime
 169	 }
 170	
 171	 println(" UI: Starting JSON serialization of ${scrapedEvents.size} events...")
 172	 val jsonStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 173	 val jsonScrapedEvents = Klaxon().toJsonString(scrapedEvents)
 174	 val jsonTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - jsonStartTime
 175	 println(" UI: JSON serialization completed in ${jsonTime}ms")
 176	
 177	 localContext.dreamParkDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 178	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY] = jsonScrapedEvents
 179	 }
 180	 lastRefreshTime = currentTime // Update UI state for last refresh time

 42	// Optimized web scraper using cached last page count, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 43	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(context: Context): MutableList<Map<String, String>> =
 44	 coroutineScope {
 45	 val totalStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 46	
 47	
 48	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 49	
 50	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration

 52	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 53	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 54	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 55	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 56	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 60	 engine {
 61	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 62	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	
 66	
 67	 try {
 68	 // Step 1: Try to use cached last page count, or fall back to binary search
 69	 val binarySearchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 70	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 71	 val cachedLastPage = getLastPageCount(context)
 72	
 73	 val lastPageWithEvents = if (cachedLastPage != null) {
 74	 // Quick verification: check if the cached page still has events
 75	 val verificationStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 76	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage)
 77	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage] = htmlContent
 78	
 79	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 80	 // Check if there's a next page with events (in case site added more)
 81	 val nextPageContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage + 1)
 82	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage + 1] = nextPageContent
 83	
 84	 val actualLastPage = if (hasEvents(nextPageContent)) {
 85	 // There are more pages, need to do a limited binary search from cached page
 86	
 87	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses, cachedLastPage)
 88	 } else {
 89	 cachedLastPage
 90	 }
 91	
 92	 System.currentTimeMillis() - verificationStart
 93	
 94	 actualLastPage
 95	 } else {
 96	 // Cached page no longer has events, do full binary search
 97	
 98	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 99	 }
 100	 } else {
 101	
 102	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 103	 }
 104	
 105	 // Save the discovered last page count for next time
 106	 saveLastPageCount(context, lastPageWithEvents)
 107	
 108	 System.currentTimeMillis() - binarySearchStartTime
 109	
 110	
 111	 // Step 2: Concurrently process all pages from 1 to lastPageWithEvents
 112	 val concurrentStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 113	 val semaphore =
 114	 Semaphore(5) // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server
 115	
 116	 val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 117	 async {
 118	 semaphore.withPermit {
 119	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 120	 }
 121	 }
 122	 }.awaitAll()
 123	 System.currentTimeMillis() - concurrentStartTime
 124	
 125	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 126	 val flattenStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 127	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 128	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 129	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 130	 }
 131	 }
 132	 System.currentTimeMillis() - flattenStartTime
 133	
 134	 System.currentTimeMillis() - totalStartTime
 135	
 136	
 137	 } finally {
 138	 client.close()
 139	 }
 140	
 141	 return@coroutineScope events
 142	 }

 144	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 145	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(
 146	 client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>, startFrom: Int = 1
 147	): Int {

 149	 var right = if (startFrom > 1) startFrom + 5 else 10 // Start from cached value or default
 150	 var lastValidPage = startFrom

 184

 194	 try {
 195	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()

 197	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(mid)) {

 216	 }

 264	// Helper function to fetch page content
 265	private suspend fun scrapePageContent(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): String {
 266	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 267	 return response.bodyAsText()
 268	}
 269	
 270	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 271	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 272	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 273	
 274	 // Check for end of events message
 275	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 276	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 277	 return false
 278	 }
 279	
 280	 // Check if page has event containers
 281	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 282	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 283	}
 284	
 285	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 286	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 287	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 288	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 289	
 290	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 291	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 292	
 293	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 294	 try {
 295	 val titleElement =
 296	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 297	 val linkElement =
 298	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 299	 val dateElement =
 300	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 301	
 302	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 303	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 304	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 305	
 306	 val event = mapOf(
 307	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 308	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 309	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 310	 )
 311	 events.add(event)
 312	 }
 313	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 314	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 315	
 316	 }
 317	 }
 318	
 319	 return events
 320	}...

 42	// Optimized web scraper using cached last page count, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 43	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(context: Context): MutableList<Map<String, String>> =

 52	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 53	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 54	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds

 56	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive

 62	 socketTimeout = 30_000

 64	 }

 122	 }.awaitAll()
 123	 System.currentTimeMillis() - concurrentStartTime

 125	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 126	 val flattenStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 127	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 128	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 129	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 130	 }
 131	 }
 132	 System.currentTimeMillis() - flattenStartTime
 133	
 134	 System.currentTimeMillis() - totalStartTime
 135	
 136	
 137	 } finally {
 138	 client.close()
 139	 }
 140	
 141	 return@coroutineScope events
 142	 }

 241	 } else {
 242	 // Fetch page if not cached
 243

 245	 System.currentTimeMillis() - fetchStartTime
 246

 24	// DataStore for caching last page count
 25	val Context.lastPageDataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "lastPageCache")
 26	val LAST_PAGE_COUNT_KEY = intPreferencesKey("last_page_count")
 27	
 28	// Get cached last page count
 29	suspend fun getLastPageCount(context: Context): Int? {
 30	 return context.lastPageDataStore.data.map { preferences ->
 31	 preferences[LAST_PAGE_COUNT_KEY]
 32	 }.firstOrNull()
 33	}
 34	
 35	// Save last page count to cache
 36	suspend fun saveLastPageCount(context: Context, pageCount: Int) {
 37	 context.lastPageDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 38	 preferences[LAST_PAGE_COUNT_KEY] = pageCount
 39	 }
 40	}

 42	// Optimized web scraper using cached last page count, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 43	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(context: Context): MutableList<Map<String, String>> =
 44	 coroutineScope {
 45	 val totalStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 46	
 47	
 48	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 49	
 50	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 51	 System.currentTimeMillis()
 52	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 53	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 54	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 55	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 56	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 57	 }
 58	
 59	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 60	 engine {
 61	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 62	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 63	 }
 64	 }
 65	
 66	
 67	 try {
 68	 // Step 1: Try to use cached last page count, or fall back to binary search
 69	 val binarySearchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 70	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 71	 val cachedLastPage = getLastPageCount(context)
 72	
 73	 val lastPageWithEvents = if (cachedLastPage != null) {
 74	 // Quick verification: check if the cached page still has events
 75	 val verificationStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 76	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage)
 77	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage] = htmlContent
 78	
 79	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 80	 // Check if there's a next page with events (in case site added more)
 81	 val nextPageContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage + 1)
 82	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage + 1] = nextPageContent
 83	
 84	 val actualLastPage = if (hasEvents(nextPageContent)) {
 85	 // There are more pages, need to do a limited binary search from cached page
 86	
 87	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses, cachedLastPage)
 88	 } else {
 89	 cachedLastPage
 90	 }
 91	
 92	 System.currentTimeMillis() - verificationStart
 93	
 94	 actualLastPage
 95	 } else {
 96	 // Cached page no longer has events, do full binary search
 97	
 98	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 99	 }
 100	 } else {
 101	
 102	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 103	 }
 104	
 105	 // Save the discovered last page count for next time
 106	 saveLastPageCount(context, lastPageWithEvents)
 107	
 108	 System.currentTimeMillis() - binarySearchStartTime
 109	
 110	
 111	 // Step 2: Concurrently process all pages from 1 to lastPageWithEvents
 112	 val concurrentStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 113	 val semaphore =
 114	 Semaphore(5) // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server
 115	
 116	 val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 117	 async {
 118	 semaphore.withPermit {
 119	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 120	 }
 121	 }
 122	 }.awaitAll()
 123	 System.currentTimeMillis() - concurrentStartTime
 124	
 125	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 126	 val flattenStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 127	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 128	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 129	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 130	 }
 131	 }
 132	 System.currentTimeMillis() - flattenStartTime
 133	
 134	 System.currentTimeMillis() - totalStartTime
 135	
 136	
 137	 } finally {
 138	 client.close()
 139	 }
 140	
 141	 return@coroutineScope events
 142	 }
 143	
 144	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 145	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(
 146	 client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>, startFrom: Int = 1
 147	): Int {
 148	 var left = startFrom
 149	 var right = if (startFrom > 1) startFrom + 5 else 10 // Start from cached value or default
 150	 var lastValidPage = startFrom
 151	
 152	 // First, find an upper bound by doubling until we find a page with no events
 153	 // Skip this phase if we already have responses cached for the range
 154	
 155	 var upperBoundRequests = 0
 156	
 157	 if (!cachedResponses.containsKey(right)) {
 158	 while (true) {
 159	 try {
 160	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 161	
 162	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, right)
 163	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 164	 upperBoundRequests++
 165	
 166	 cachedResponses[right] = htmlContent
 167	
 168	
 169	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 170	 lastValidPage = right
 171	 left = right
 172	 right *= 2 // Double the search range
 173	 } else {
 174	 // Found a page with no events, this is our upper bound
 175	
 176	 break
 177	 }
 178	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 179	
 180	 break
 181	 }
 182	 }
 183	 } else {
 184	
 185	 }
 186	
 187	
 188	 // Now perform binary search between left and right
 189	
 190	 var binarySearchRequests = 0
 191	 while (left <= right) {
 192	 val mid = (left + right) / 2
 193	
 194	 try {
 195	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 196	
 197	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(mid)) {
 198	
 199	 cachedResponses[mid]!!
 200	 } else {
 201	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, mid)
 202	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 203	 binarySearchRequests++
 204	
 205	 cachedResponses[mid] = content
 206	 content
 207	 }
 208	
 209	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 210	 lastValidPage = mid
 211	 left = mid + 1
 212	
 213	 } else {
 214	 right = mid - 1
 215	
 216	 }
 217	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 218	
 219	 right = mid - 1
 220	 }
 221	 }
 222	
 223	
 224	
 225	 return lastValidPage
 226	}

 228	// Process a single page concurrently, using cache if available or fetching if needed
 229	private suspend fun processPageConcurrently(
 230	 client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int, cachedResponses: Map<Int, String>
 231	): List<Map<String, String>>? {
 232	 return try {
 233	 val pageStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 234	
 235	
 236	 val fetchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 237	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(pageIndex)) {
 238	 // Use cached response from binary search
 239	
 240	 cachedResponses[pageIndex]!!
 241	 } else {
 242	 // Fetch page if not cached
 243	
 244	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, pageIndex)
 245	 System.currentTimeMillis() - fetchStartTime
 246	
 247	 content
 248	 }
 249	
 250	 val parseStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 251	 val pageEvents = parsePage(htmlContent)
 252	 System.currentTimeMillis() - parseStartTime
 253	 System.currentTimeMillis() - pageStartTime
 254	
 255	
 256	 pageEvents
 257	
 258	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 259	
 260	 null
 261	 }
 262	}
 263	
 264	// Helper function to fetch page content
 265	private suspend fun scrapePageContent(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): String {
 266	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 267	 return response.bodyAsText()
 268	}
 269	
 270	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 271	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 272	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 273	
 274	 // Check for end of events message
 275	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 276	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 277	 return false
 278	 }
 279	
 280	 // Check if page has event containers
 281	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 282	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 283	}
 284	
 285	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 286	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<Map<String, String>> {
 287	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 288	 val events = mutableListOf<Map<String, String>>()
 289	
 290	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 291	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 292	
 293	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 294	 try {
 295	 val titleElement =
 296	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 297	 val linkElement =
 298	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 299	 val dateElement =
 300	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 301	
 302	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 303	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 304	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 305	
 306	 val event = mapOf(
 307	 "title" to titleElement.text(),
 308	 "link" to linkElement.attr("href"),
 309	 "dateOnly" to dateOnly
 310	 )
 311	 events.add(event)
 312	 }
 313	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 314	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 315	
 316	 }
 317	 }
 318	
 319	 return events
 320	}...

 25	// DataStore for caching last page count
 26	val Context.lastPageDataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "lastPageCache")
 27	val LAST_PAGE_COUNT_KEY = intPreferencesKey("last_page_count")
 28	
 29	// Get cached last page count
 30	suspend fun getLastPageCount(context: Context): Int? {
 31	 return context.lastPageDataStore.data.map { preferences ->
 32	 preferences[LAST_PAGE_COUNT_KEY]
 33	 }.firstOrNull()
 34	}
 35	
 36	// Save last page count to cache
 37	suspend fun saveLastPageCount(context: Context, pageCount: Int) {
 38	 context.lastPageDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 39	 preferences[LAST_PAGE_COUNT_KEY] = pageCount
 40	 }
 41	}

 43	// Optimized web scraper using cached last page count, then concurrent processing with cached responses
 44	suspend fun scrapeDreamParkEvents(context: Context): List<DreamParkEvent> =
 45	 coroutineScope {
 46	 val totalStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 47	
 48	
 49	 val events = mutableListOf<DreamParkEvent>()
 50	
 51	 // Create a single HTTP client with optimized configuration
 52	 System.currentTimeMillis()
 53	 val client = HttpClient(Android) {
 54	 install(HttpTimeout) {
 55	 requestTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 56	 connectTimeoutMillis = 15.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 57	 socketTimeoutMillis = 30.seconds.inWholeMilliseconds
 58	 }
 59	
 60	 // Enable connection pooling and keep-alive
 61	 engine {
 62	 connectTimeout = 15_000
 63	 socketTimeout = 30_000
 64	 }
 65	 }
 66	
 67	
 68	 try {
 69	 // Step 1: Try to use cached last page count, or fall back to binary search
 70	 val binarySearchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 71	 val cachedResponses = mutableMapOf<Int, String>()
 72	 val cachedLastPage = getLastPageCount(context)
 73	
 74	 val lastPageWithEvents = if (cachedLastPage != null) {
 75	 // Quick verification: check if the cached page still has events
 76	 val verificationStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 77	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage)
 78	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage] = htmlContent
 79	
 80	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 81	 // Check if there's a next page with events (in case site added more)
 82	 val nextPageContent = scrapePageContent(client, cachedLastPage + 1)
 83	 cachedResponses[cachedLastPage + 1] = nextPageContent
 84	
 85	 val actualLastPage = if (hasEvents(nextPageContent)) {
 86	 // There are more pages, need to do a limited binary search from cached page
 87	
 88	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses, cachedLastPage)
 89	 } else {
 90	 cachedLastPage
 91	 }
 92	
 93	 System.currentTimeMillis() - verificationStart
 94	
 95	 actualLastPage
 96	 } else {
 97	 // Cached page no longer has events, do full binary search
 98	
 99	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 100	 }
 101	 } else {
 102	
 103	 findLastPageWithBinarySearch(client, cachedResponses)
 104	 }
 105	
 106	 // Save the discovered last page count for next time
 107	 saveLastPageCount(context, lastPageWithEvents)
 108	
 109	 System.currentTimeMillis() - binarySearchStartTime
 110	
 111	
 112	 // Step 2: Concurrently process all pages from 1 to lastPageWithEvents
 113	 val concurrentStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 114	 val semaphore =
 115	 Semaphore(5) // Limit concurrent requests to avoid overwhelming the server
 116	
 117	 val allPageEvents = (1..lastPageWithEvents).map { pageIndex ->
 118	 async {
 119	 semaphore.withPermit {
 120	 processPageConcurrently(client, pageIndex, cachedResponses)
 121	 }
 122	 }
 123	 }.awaitAll()
 124	 System.currentTimeMillis() - concurrentStartTime
 125	
 126	 // Flatten all events from all pages
 127	 val flattenStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 128	 allPageEvents.forEach { pageEvents ->
 129	 if (pageEvents != null) {
 130	 events.addAll(pageEvents)
 131	 }
 132	 }
 133	 System.currentTimeMillis() - flattenStartTime
 134	
 135	 System.currentTimeMillis() - totalStartTime
 136	
 137	
 138	 } finally {
 139	 client.close()
 140	 }
 141	
 142	 return@coroutineScope events
 143	 }

 145	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 146	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(
 147	 client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>, startFrom: Int = 1
 148	): Int {
 149	 var left = startFrom
 150	 var right = if (startFrom > 1) startFrom + 5 else 10 // Start from cached value or default
 151	 var lastValidPage = startFrom
 152	
 153	 // First, find an upper bound by doubling until we find a page with no events
 154	 // Skip this phase if we already have responses cached for the range
 155	
 156	 var upperBoundRequests = 0
 157	
 158	 if (!cachedResponses.containsKey(right)) {
 159	 while (true) {
 160	 try {
 161	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 162	
 163	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, right)
 164	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 165	 upperBoundRequests++
 166	
 167	 cachedResponses[right] = htmlContent
 168	
 169	
 170	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 171	 lastValidPage = right
 172	 left = right
 173	 right *= 2 // Double the search range
 174	 } else {
 175	 // Found a page with no events, this is our upper bound
 176	
 177	 break
 178	 }
 179	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 180	
 181	 break
 182	 }
 183	 }
 184	 } else {
 185	
 186	 }
 187	
 188	
 189	 // Now perform binary search between left and right
 190	
 191	 var binarySearchRequests = 0
 192	 while (left <= right) {
 193	 val mid = (left + right) / 2
 194	
 195	 try {
 196	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 197	
 198	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(mid)) {
 199	
 200	 cachedResponses[mid]!!
 201	 } else {
 202	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, mid)
 203	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 204	 binarySearchRequests++
 205	
 206	 cachedResponses[mid] = content
 207	 content
 208	 }
 209	
 210	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 211	 lastValidPage = mid
 212	 left = mid + 1
 213	
 214	 } else {
 215	 right = mid - 1
 216	
 217	 }
 218	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 219	
 220	 right = mid - 1
 221	 }
 222	 }
 223	
 224	
 225	
 226	 return lastValidPage
 227	}

 229	// Process a single page concurrently, using cache if available or fetching if needed
 230	private suspend fun processPageConcurrently(
 231	 client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int, cachedResponses: Map<Int, String>
 232	): List<DreamParkEvent>? {
 233	 return try {
 234	 val pageStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 235	
 236	
 237	 val fetchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 238	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(pageIndex)) {
 239	 // Use cached response from binary search
 240	
 241	 cachedResponses[pageIndex]!!
 242	 } else {
 243	 // Fetch page if not cached
 244	
 245	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, pageIndex)
 246	 System.currentTimeMillis() - fetchStartTime
 247	
 248	 content
 249	 }
 250	
 251	 val parseStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 252	 val pageEvents = parsePage(htmlContent)
 253	 System.currentTimeMillis() - parseStartTime
 254	 System.currentTimeMillis() - pageStartTime
 255	
 256	
 257	 pageEvents
 258	
 259	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 260	
 261	 null
 262	 }
 263	}
 264	
 265	// Helper function to fetch page content
 266	private suspend fun scrapePageContent(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): String {
 267	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 268	 return response.bodyAsText()
 269	}
 270	
 271	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 272	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 273	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 274	
 275	 // Check for end of events message
 276	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 277	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 278	 return false
 279	 }
 280	
 281	 // Check if page has event containers
 282	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 283	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 284	}
 285	
 286	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 287	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<DreamParkEvent> {
 288	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 289	 val events = mutableListOf<DreamParkEvent>()
 290	
 291	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 292	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 293	
 294	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 295	 try {
 296	 val titleElement =
 297	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 298	 val linkElement =
 299	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 300	 val dateElement =
 301	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 302	
 303	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 304	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 305	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 306	
 307	 val event = DreamParkEvent(
 308	 title = titleElement.text(),
 309	 link = linkElement.attr("href"),
 310	 date = dateOnly
 311	 )
 312	 events.add(event)
 313	 }
 314	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 315	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 316	
 317	 }
 318	 }
 319	
 320	 return events
 321	}

 70	suspend fun getLastRefreshTimeString(context: Context): String? {
 71	 return context.dataStore.data
 72	 .map { preferences ->
 73	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY]
 74	 }
 75	 .firstOrNull()
 76	}
 77	
 78	suspend fun getLastScrapeResult(context: Context): List<DreamParkEvent>? {
 79	 val jsonString = context.dreamParkDataStore.data
 80	 .map { preferences ->
 81	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY]
 82	 }
 83	 .firstOrNull()
 84	
 85	 return jsonString?.let {
 86	 try {
 87	 val parser = Parser.default()
 88	 val stringBuilder = StringBuilder(it)
 89	 val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>
 90	
 91	 json?.mapNotNull { item ->
 92	 (item as? JsonObject)?.let { jsonObject ->
 93	 val eventMap = jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }
 94	 DreamParkEvent(
 95	 title = eventMap["title"] ?: "Unknown Event",
 96	 date = eventMap["dateOnly"] ?: "Date TBD",
 97	 link = eventMap["link"] ?: ""
 98	 )
 99	 }
 100	 }
 101	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 102	 null
 103	 }
 104	 }
 105	}
 106	
 107	
 108	val Context.dataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "lastRefresh")
 109	val LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY = stringPreferencesKey("last_refresh_time")
 110	
 111	val Context.dreamParkDataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "dreamParkData")
 112	val LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY = stringPreferencesKey("last_scrape_result")
 113	
 114	
 115	@OptIn(ExperimentalMaterial3Api::class)
 116	@Composable
 117	fun ListViewScreen(navController: NavController, context: MainActivity) {
 118	 val localContext = LocalContext.current
 119	 var dreamParkEvents by remember { mutableStateOf<List<DreamParkEvent>>(emptyList()) }
 120	 var isLoading by remember { mutableStateOf(true) } // Start as true
 121	 var errorMessage by remember { mutableStateOf<String?>(null) }
 122	 var lastRefreshTime by remember { mutableStateOf<String?>(null) }
 123	 var refreshTrigger by remember { mutableStateOf(0) }
 124	
 125	 fun forceRefresh() {
 126	 refreshTrigger++
 127	 }
 128	
 129	 LaunchedEffect(refreshTrigger) { // Triggers on initial load and manual refresh
 130	 isLoading = true
 131	 errorMessage = null // Reset error message at the start of a load
 132	
 133	 try {
 134	 val lastRefreshTimeStr = getLastRefreshTimeString(localContext)
 135	 lastRefreshTime = lastRefreshTimeStr
 136	
 137	 val needsFreshScrape: Boolean
 138	 val lastRefreshMillis = lastRefreshTimeStr?.toLongOrNull()
 139	 // Using a shorter duration for easier testing of refresh logic if needed, e.g., 1 minute
 140	 // val oneWeekInMillis = 1 * 60 * 1000L // 1 minute for testing
 141	 val oneWeekInMillis = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000L // 7 days
 142	
 143	 // Force fresh scrape if this is a manual refresh (refreshTrigger > 0)
 144	 if (refreshTrigger > 0) {
 145	 needsFreshScrape = true
 146	 } else if (lastRefreshMillis == null) {
 147	 needsFreshScrape = true
 148	 } else {
 149	 val timeSinceLastRefresh = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastRefreshMillis
 150	 needsFreshScrape = timeSinceLastRefresh >= oneWeekInMillis
 151	 }
 152	
 153	 var loadedFromCache = false // Reset this flag
 154	 val cachedScrapeResult = getLastScrapeResult(localContext) // Uses Klaxon
 155	
 156	 if (needsFreshScrape || cachedScrapeResult == null) { // Modified condition: always scrape if cache is null
 157	 try {
 158	 println(" UI: Starting fresh scrape...")
 159	 val scrapeStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 160	
 161	 val scrapedEvents: List<DreamParkEvent> = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 162	 scrapeDreamParkEvents(localContext)
 163	 }
 164	 val scrapeTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 165	 println(" UI: Scraping completed in ${scrapeTime}ms")
 166	
 167	 dreamParkEvents = scrapedEvents
 168	 errorMessage = null // Clear error if scrape is successful
 169	
 170	 val cacheStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 171	 withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 172	 val currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis().toString()
 173	 localContext.dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 174	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY] = currentTime
 175	 }
 176	
 177	 println(" UI: Starting JSON serialization of ${scrapedEvents.size} events...")
 178	 val jsonStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 179	 // Convert back to map format for JSON serialization
 180	 val eventsForJson = scrapedEvents.map { event ->
 181	 mapOf(
 182	 "title" to event.title,
 183	 "dateOnly" to event.date,
 184	 "link" to event.link
 185	 )
 186	 }
 187	 val jsonScrapedEvents = Klaxon().toJsonString(eventsForJson)
 188	 val jsonTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - jsonStartTime
 189	 println(" UI: JSON serialization completed in ${jsonTime}ms")
 190	
 191	 localContext.dreamParkDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 192	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY] = jsonScrapedEvents
 193	 }
 194	 lastRefreshTime = currentTime // Update UI state for last refresh time
 195	 }
 196	 val cacheTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - cacheStartTime
 197	 println(" UI: Caching completed in ${cacheTime}ms")
 198	
 199	 val totalRefreshTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 200	 println(" UI: TOTAL REFRESH TIME: ${totalRefreshTime}ms (${totalRefreshTime/1000.0}s)")
 201	 println(" UI Performance breakdown:")
 202	 println(" - Web scraping: ${scrapeTime}ms (${(scrapeTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 203	 println(" - Caching (JSON + DataStore): ${cacheTime}ms (${(cacheTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 204	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 205	 errorMessage = "Failed to load fresh events: ${e.message}"
 206	 if (cachedScrapeResult != null) {
 207	 dreamParkEvents = cachedScrapeResult
 208	 loadedFromCache = true
 209	 errorMessage = "Showing older data. Failed to refresh: ${e.message}"
 210	 } else {
 211	 errorMessage = "Failed to load events and no cached data available: ${e.message}"
 212	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList() // Ensure events list is empty
 213	 }
 214	 }
 215	 } else { // This else means: needsFreshScrape is false AND cachedScrapeResult is NOT null
 216	 dreamParkEvents = cachedScrapeResult
 217	 loadedFromCache = true
 218	 // Optionally clear error if successfully loaded from cache
 219	 // errorMessage = null
 220	 }
 221	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 222	 // This is a global catch block for any unhandled exceptions in the LaunchedEffect's try block.
 223	 errorMessage = "An critical error occurred: ${e.message}"
 224	 if (dreamParkEvents.isEmpty()) { // If events are still empty, try to load from cache one last time
 225	 val fallbackCache = getLastScrapeResult(localContext)
 226	 if (fallbackCache != null) {
 227	 dreamParkEvents = fallbackCache
 228	 errorMessage += " Displaying cached data if possible."
 229	 } else {
 230	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList()
 231	 }
 232	 }
 233	 } finally {
 234	 isLoading = false
 235	 }
 236	 }
 237	
 238	 Scaffold(
 239	 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxSize(),
 240	 topBar = {
 241	 LargeTopAppBar(
 242	 title = {
 243	 Text(
 244	 text = "Equine Events",
 245	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.headlineMedium
 246	 )
 247	 },
 248	 actions = {
 249	 IconButton(
 250	 onClick = { forceRefresh() },
 251	 enabled = !isLoading
 252	 ) {
 253	 Icon(
 254	 imageVector = Icons.Default.Refresh,
 255	 contentDescription = "Refresh events"
 256	 )
 257	 }
 258	 },
 259	 colors = TopAppBarDefaults.largeTopAppBarColors(
 260	 containerColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.surface,
 261	 titleContentColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurface
 262	 )
 263	 )
 264	 }
 265	 ) { innerPadding ->
 266	 when {
 267	 isLoading -> {
 268	 Box(
 269	 modifier = Modifier
 270	 .fillMaxSize()
 271	 .padding(innerPadding),
 272	 contentAlignment = Alignment.Center
 273	 ) {
 274	 Column(
 275	 horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally,
 276	 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.Center
 277	 ) {
 278	 CircularProgressIndicator(
 279	 modifier = Modifier.size(48.dp),
 280	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 281	 strokeWidth = 4.dp
 282	 )
 283	 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(16.dp))
 284	 Text(
 285	 text = "Loading events...",
 286	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyLarge,
 287	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant
 288	 )
 289	 }
 290	 }
 291	 }

```kotlin
android {
 namespace = "your.new.package.name"
 
 defaultConfig {
 applicationId = "your.new.package.name"
 // other config remains the same
 }
 // rest of the config
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/res/values/strings.xml" mode="EDIT">
```xml
<resources>
 <string name="app_name">YourNewAppName</string>
</resources>
```
</augment_code_snippet>

<augment_code_snippet path="settings.gradle.kts" mode="EDIT">
```kotlin
rootProject.name = "YourNewAppName"
// rest of the file remains the same
```
</augment_code_snippet>

After making these changes, you'll need to:

1. Refactor your package structure:
 - Right-click on your package in Android Studio
 - Select Refactor > Rename
 - Enter your new package name
 - Check "Search in comments and strings" and "Search for text occurrences"

2. Update imports in all your Kotlin files to use the new package name

3. Clean and rebuild your project:
 - Select Build > Clean Project
 - Then Build > Rebuild Project

This will rename your app and update the package name throughout your project.

 73	suspend fun getLastRefreshTimeString(context: Context): String? {
 74	 return context.dataStore.data
 75	 .map { preferences ->
 76	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY]
 77	 }
 78	 .firstOrNull()
 79	}

 81	suspend fun getLastScrapeResult(context: Context): List<DreamParkEvent>? {
 82	 val jsonString = context.dreamParkDataStore.data
 83	 .map { preferences ->
 84	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY]
 85	 }
 86	 .firstOrNull()
 87	
 88	 return jsonString?.let {
 89	 try {
 90	 val parser = Parser.default()
 91	 val stringBuilder = StringBuilder(it)
 92	 val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>
 93	
 94	 json?.mapNotNull { item ->
 95	 (item as? JsonObject)?.let { jsonObject ->
 96	 val eventMap = jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }
 97	 val rawDateString = eventMap["dateOnly"] ?: "Date TBD"
 98	 val (startDate, endDate) = EventDateParser.parseDateString(rawDateString)
 99	
 100	 DreamParkEvent(
 101	 title = eventMap["title"] ?: "Unknown Event",
 102	 rawDateString = rawDateString,
 103	 startDate = startDate,
 104	 endDate = endDate,
 105	 link = eventMap["link"] ?: ""
 106	 )
 107	 }
 108	 }
 109	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 110	 null
 111	 }
 112	 }
 113	}

 136	 fun forceRefresh() {
 137	 refreshTrigger++

 140	 // Function to toggle star status of an event
 141	 suspend fun toggleEventStar(event: DreamParkEvent) {
 142	 val newStarredStatus = starredEventsManager.toggleEventStar(event.uniqueId)
 143	 // Update the local state immediately for better UX
 144	 dreamParkEvents = dreamParkEvents.map {
 145	 if (it.uniqueId == event.uniqueId) {
 146	 it.copy(isStarred = newStarredStatus)
 147	 } else {
 148	 it
 149	 }
 150	 }
 151	 }
