 153	 LaunchedEffect(refreshTrigger) { // Triggers on initial load and manual refresh
 154	 isLoading = true
 155	 errorMessage = null // Reset error message at the start of a load
 156	
 157	 try {
 158	 val lastRefreshTimeStr = getLastRefreshTimeString(localContext)
 159	 lastRefreshTime = lastRefreshTimeStr
 160	
 161	 val needsFreshScrape: Boolean
 162	 val lastRefreshMillis = lastRefreshTimeStr?.toLongOrNull()
 163	 // Using a shorter duration for easier testing of refresh logic if needed, e.g., 1 minute
 164	 // val oneWeekInMillis = 1 * 60 * 1000L // 1 minute for testing
 165	 val oneWeekInMillis = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000L // 7 days
 166	
 167	 // Force fresh scrape if this is a manual refresh (refreshTrigger > 0)
 168	 if (refreshTrigger > 0) {
 169	 needsFreshScrape = true
 170	 } else if (lastRefreshMillis == null) {
 171	 needsFreshScrape = true
 172	 } else {
 173	 val timeSinceLastRefresh = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastRefreshMillis
 174	 needsFreshScrape = timeSinceLastRefresh >= oneWeekInMillis
 175	 }
 176	
 177	 var loadedFromCache = false // Reset this flag
 178	 val cachedScrapeResult = getLastScrapeResult(localContext) // Uses Klaxon
 179	
 180	 if (needsFreshScrape || cachedScrapeResult == null) { // Modified condition: always scrape if cache is null
 181	 try {
 182	 println(" UI: Starting fresh scrape...")
 183	 val scrapeStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 184	
 185	 val scrapedEvents: List<DreamParkEvent> = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 186	 scrapeDreamParkEvents(localContext)
 187	 }
 188	 val scrapeTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 189	 println(" UI: Scraping completed in ${scrapeTime}ms")
 190	
 191	 // Apply starred status to scraped events
 192	 val eventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 193	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(scrapedEvents)
 194	 }
 195	 dreamParkEvents = eventsWithStarredStatus
 196	 errorMessage = null // Clear error if scrape is successful
 197	
 198	 val cacheStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 199	 withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 200	 val currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis().toString()
 201	 localContext.dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 202	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY] = currentTime
 203	 }
 204	
 205	 println(" UI: Starting JSON serialization of ${scrapedEvents.size} events...")
 206	 val jsonStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 207	 // Convert back to map format for JSON serialization
 208	 val eventsForJson = scrapedEvents.map { event ->
 209	 mapOf(
 210	 "title" to event.title,
 211	 "dateOnly" to event.rawDateString,
 212	 "link" to event.link
 213	 )
 214	 }
 215	 val jsonScrapedEvents = Klaxon().toJsonString(eventsForJson)
 216	 val jsonTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - jsonStartTime
 217	 println(" UI: JSON serialization completed in ${jsonTime}ms")
 218	
 219	 localContext.dreamParkDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 220	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY] = jsonScrapedEvents
 221	 }
 222	 lastRefreshTime = currentTime // Update UI state for last refresh time
 223	 }
 224	 val cacheTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - cacheStartTime
 225	 println(" UI: Caching completed in ${cacheTime}ms")
 226	
 227	 val totalRefreshTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 228	 println(" UI: TOTAL REFRESH TIME: ${totalRefreshTime}ms (${totalRefreshTime/1000.0}s)")
 229	 println(" UI Performance breakdown:")
 230	 println(" - Web scraping: ${scrapeTime}ms (${(scrapeTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 231	 println(" - Caching (JSON + DataStore): ${cacheTime}ms (${(cacheTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 232	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 233	 errorMessage = "Failed to load fresh events: ${e.message}"
 234	 if (cachedScrapeResult != null) {
 235	 val cachedEventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 236	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(cachedScrapeResult)
 237	 }
 238	 dreamParkEvents = cachedEventsWithStarredStatus
 239	 loadedFromCache = true
 240	 errorMessage = "Showing older data. Failed to refresh: ${e.message}"
 241	 } else {
 242	 errorMessage = "Failed to load events and no cached data available: ${e.message}"
 243	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList() // Ensure events list is empty
 244	 }
 245	 }
 246	 } else { // This else means: needsFreshScrape is false AND cachedScrapeResult is NOT null
 247	 val cachedEventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 248	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(cachedScrapeResult)
 249	 }
 250	 dreamParkEvents = cachedEventsWithStarredStatus
 251	 loadedFromCache = true
 252	 // Optionally clear error if successfully loaded from cache
 253	 // errorMessage = null
 254	 }
 255	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 256	 // This is a global catch block for any unhandled exceptions in the LaunchedEffect's try block.
 257	 errorMessage = "An critical error occurred: ${e.message}"
 258	 if (dreamParkEvents.isEmpty()) { // If events are still empty, try to load from cache one last time
 259	 val fallbackCache = getLastScrapeResult(localContext)
 260	 if (fallbackCache != null) {
 261	 val fallbackEventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 262	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(fallbackCache)
 263	 }
 264	 dreamParkEvents = fallbackEventsWithStarredStatus
 265	 errorMessage += " Displaying cached data if possible."
 266	 } else {
 267	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList()
 268	 }
 269	 }
 270	 } finally {
 271	 isLoading = false
 272	 }
 273	 }

 408	@Composable
 409	private fun EventCard(
 410	 event: DreamParkEvent,
 411	 onEventClick: (String) -> Unit,
 412	 onStarClick: (DreamParkEvent) -> Unit
 413	) {
 414	 Card(
 415	 modifier = Modifier
 416	 .fillMaxWidth()
 417	 .clickable { onEventClick(event.link) },
 418	 colors = CardDefaults.cardColors(
 419	 containerColor = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.surfaceVariant
 420	 ),
 421	 elevation = CardDefaults.cardElevation(
 422	 defaultElevation = 4.dp,
 423	 pressedElevation = 8.dp
 424	 ),
 425	 shape = RoundedCornerShape(12.dp)
 426	 ) {
 427	 Column(
 428	 modifier = Modifier
 429	 .fillMaxWidth()
 430	 .padding(20.dp)
 431	 ) {
 432	 // Main content row with event icon, title/date, and star button
 433	 Row(
 434	 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 435	 verticalAlignment = Alignment.Top
 436	 ) {
 437	 Icon(
 438	 imageVector = Icons.Default.Event,
 439	 contentDescription = null,
 440	 modifier = Modifier.size(24.dp),
 441	 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 442	 )
 443	 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.width(12.dp))
 444	 Column(
 445	 modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)
 446	 ) {
 447	 Text(
 448	 text = event.title,
 449	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.titleMedium,
 450	 fontWeight = FontWeight.SemiBold,
 451	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurface,
 452	 maxLines = 2,
 453	 overflow = TextOverflow.Ellipsis
 454	 )
 455	 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(8.dp))
 456	 Row(
 457	 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically
 458	 ) {
 459	 Icon(
 460	 imageVector = Icons.Default.CalendarMonth,
 461	 contentDescription = null,
 462	 modifier = Modifier.size(16.dp),
 463	 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant
 464	 )
 465	 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.width(6.dp))
 466	 Text(
 467	 text = event.formattedDateString,
 468	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyMedium,
 469	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant
 470	 )
 471	 }
 472	 }
 473	
 474	 // Right edge actions column
 475	 Column(
 476	 horizontalAlignment = Alignment.End
 477	 ) {
 478	 // Prominent star button
 479	 IconButton(
 480	 onClick = { onStarClick(event) },
 481	 modifier = Modifier.size(48.dp)
 482	 ) {
 483	 Icon(
 484	 imageVector = if (event.isStarred) Icons.Filled.Star else Icons.Outlined.StarBorder,
 485	 contentDescription = if (event.isStarred) "Unstar event" else "Star event",
 486	 modifier = Modifier.size(28.dp),
 487	 tint = if (event.isStarred) {
 488	 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 489	 } else {
 490	 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant.copy(alpha = 0.7f)
 491	 }
 492	 )
 493	 }
 494	
 495	 // View Details button on edge, aligned with date row
 496	 if (event.link.isNotEmpty()) {
 497	 Row(
 498	 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically,
 499	 modifier = Modifier.padding(end = 12.dp, top = 8.dp)
 500	 ) {
 501	 Text(

 503	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodySmall,
 504	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 505	 modifier = Modifier.padding(end = 4.dp)

 507	 Icon(

 509	 contentDescription = "Open event link",
 510	 modifier = Modifier.size(16.dp),
 511	 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 512	 )
 513	 }
 514	 }
 515	 }
 516	 }
 517	 }

","workspace_file_chunks":[]},{"status":"success","request_id":"949be645-2a8c-4700-8f28-0fbfdfcbfc00","request_message":"","structured_output_nodes":[{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Perfect! I've restructured the layout to fix the vertical alignment issue. Here's what I changed:

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
 Row(
 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically,
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth()
 ) {
 Icon(
 imageVector = Icons.Default.CalendarMonth,
 contentDescription = null,
 modifier = Modifier.size(16.dp),
 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant
 )
 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.width(6.dp))
 Text(
 text = event.formattedDateString,
 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyMedium,
 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant,
 modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)
 )
 
 // View Details button aligned with date row
 if (event.link.isNotEmpty()) {
 Row(
 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically,
 modifier = Modifier.padding(start = 8.dp)
 ) {
 Text(
 text = "View Details",
 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodySmall,
 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 modifier = Modifier.padding(end = 4.dp)
 )
 Icon(
 imageVector = Icons.AutoMirrored.Filled.OpenInNew,
 contentDescription = "Open event link",
 modifier = Modifier.size(16.dp),
 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 )
 }
 }
 }
```
</augment_code_snippet>

**Key improvements made:**

1. **Moved "View Details" into the date row**: The "View Details" button is now part of the same Row as the calendar icon and date text, ensuring they're always vertically centered together.

2. **Added weight to date text**: The date text now has `modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)`, allowing it to take up available space and push the "View Details" button to the right.

3. **Simplified star button placement**: The star button is now directly in the main Row instead of being in a separate Column, making the layout cleaner.

4. **Removed fixed padding**: Eliminated the problematic `top = 8.dp` padding that was causing misalignment when text wrapped.

5. **Added proper spacing**: Used `padding(start = 8.dp)` to provide appropriate spacing between the date text and "View Details" button.

Now when the date text wraps to multiple lines, the "View Details" button will automatically center vertically within that multi-line date row, providing a much better visual alignment.

Now I've restored the layout structure where the "View Details" button is positioned at the right edge of the EventCard, but with improved alignment. Here's what the changes accomplish:

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/ui/ListViewScreen.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
 // Main content row with title/date and star button
 Row(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically
 ) {
 Column(
 modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)
 ) {
 Text(
 text = event.title,
 style = MaterialTheme.typography.titleMedium,
 fontWeight = FontWeight.SemiBold,
 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurface,
 maxLines = 2,
 overflow = TextOverflow.Ellipsis
 )
 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(8.dp))
 Row(
 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically
 ) {
 Icon(
 imageVector = Icons.Default.CalendarMonth,
 contentDescription = null,
 modifier = Modifier.size(16.dp),
 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant
 )
 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.width(6.dp))
 Text(
 text = event.formattedDateString,
 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyMedium,
 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant
 )
 }
 }

 // Right edge actions column
 Column(
 horizontalAlignment = Alignment.End
 ) {
 // Prominent star button
 IconButton(
 onClick = { onStarClick(event) },
 modifier = Modifier.size(48.dp)
 ) {
 Icon(
 imageVector = if (event.isStarred) Icons.Filled.Star else Icons.Outlined.StarBorder,
 contentDescription = if (event.isStarred) "Unstar event" else "Star event",
 modifier = Modifier.size(28.dp),
 tint = if (event.isStarred) {
 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 } else {
 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant.copy(alpha = 0.7f)
 }
 )
 }

 // View Details button on edge, aligned with date row
 if (event.link.isNotEmpty()) {
 Row(
 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically,
 modifier = Modifier.padding(end = 12.dp)
 ) {
 Text(
 text = "View Details",
 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodySmall,
 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 modifier = Modifier.padding(end = 4.dp)
 )
 Icon(
 imageVector = Icons.AutoMirrored.Filled.OpenInNew,
 contentDescription = "Open event link",
 modifier = Modifier.size(16.dp),
 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 )
 }
 }
 }
 }
```
</augment_code_snippet>

**Key improvements:**

1. **"View Details" stays at the edge**: The button remains positioned at the right edge of the EventCard in the right actions column.

2. **Better vertical alignment**: Changed the main Row's `verticalAlignment` from `Alignment.Top` to `Alignment.CenterVertically`, which means the entire right column (containing both the star button and "View Details" button) will center vertically with the left content column.

3. **Removed problematic fixed padding**: Eliminated the `top = 8.dp` padding that was causing misalignment issues.

4. **Maintained proper spacing**: Kept the `end = 12.dp` padding to maintain proper edge spacing.

Now when the date text wraps to multiple lines, the entire right column (including the "View Details" button) will center vertically with the left content column, providing much better visual balance while keeping the "View Details" button positioned at the card's edge as requested.

 1	package com.calvinsteck.equineevents.data
 2	
 3	import java.time.LocalDate
 4	import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter
 5	import java.time.format.TextStyle
 6	import java.util.Locale
 7	
 8	// Data class for better performance and type safety
 9	data class DreamParkEvent(
 10	 val title: String,
 11	 val rawDateString: String, // Original scraped date string
 12	 val startDate: LocalDate,
 13	 val endDate: LocalDate?, // null if single day event
 14	 val link: String,
 15	 val isStarred: Boolean = false
 16	) {
 17	 // Generate a stable key for LazyColumn using hashCode for better performance
 18	 val key: String by lazy { "${title.hashCode()}_${rawDateString.hashCode()}" }
 19	
 20	 // Generate a unique identifier for starring (independent of starred status)
 21	 val uniqueId: String by lazy { "${title}_${rawDateString}_${link}".hashCode().toString() }
 22	
 23	 // Format date for display with day of week
 24	 val formattedDateString: String by lazy {
 25	 val dayOfWeek = startDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 26	 val formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM d")
 27	
 28	 if (endDate != null && endDate != startDate) {
 29	 val endDayOfWeek = endDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 30	 val endFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM d")
 31	 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)} - $endDayOfWeek, ${endDate.format(endFormatter)}"
 32	 } else {
 33	 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)}"
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	}
 37	
 38	// Utility object for parsing date strings
 39	object EventDateParser {
 40	 private val monthMap = mapOf(
 41	 "january" to 1, "jan" to 1,
 42	 "february" to 2, "feb" to 2,
 43	 "march" to 3, "mar" to 3,
 44	 "april" to 4, "apr" to 4,
 45	 "may" to 5,
 46	 "june" to 6, "jun" to 6,
 47	 "july" to 7, "jul" to 7,
 48	 "august" to 8, "aug" to 8,
 49	 "september" to 9, "sep" to 9, "sept" to 9,
 50	 "october" to 10, "oct" to 10,
 51	 "november" to 11, "nov" to 11,
 52	 "december" to 12, "dec" to 12
 53	 )
 54	
 55	 /**
 56	 * Parse date strings in formats:
 57	 * - "March 15" (single day)
 58	 * - "March 15 - March 17" (date range)
 59	 * - "March 15 - April 2" (cross-month range)
 60	 * Assumes current year if no year is specified
 61	 */
 62	 fun parseDateString(dateString: String): Pair<LocalDate, LocalDate?> {
 63	 val currentYear = LocalDate.now().year
 64	 val cleanDateString = dateString.trim().lowercase()
 65	
 66	 return try {
 67	 if (cleanDateString.contains(" - ")) {
 68	 // Date range format
 69	 val parts = cleanDateString.split(" - ")
 70	 val startPart = parts[0].trim()
 71	 val endPart = parts[1].trim()
 72	
 73	 val startDate = parseDate(startPart, currentYear)
 74	 val endDate = parseDate(endPart, currentYear)
 75	
 76	 Pair(startDate, endDate)
 77	 } else {
 78	 // Single date format
 79	 val date = parseDate(cleanDateString, currentYear)
 80	 Pair(date, null)
 81	 }
 82	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 83	 // Fallback to current date if parsing fails
 84	 val fallbackDate = LocalDate.now()
 85	 Pair(fallbackDate, null)
 86	 }
 87	 }
 88	
 89	 private fun parseDate(dateString: String, year: Int): LocalDate {
 90	 val parts = dateString.trim().split(" ")
 91	 if (parts.size < 2) throw IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date format: $dateString")
 92	
 93	 val monthName = parts[0].lowercase()
 94	 val day = parts[1].toInt()
 95	
 96	 val month = monthMap[monthName] ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Unknown month: $monthName")
 97	
 98	 return LocalDate.of(year, month, day)
 99	 }
 100	}

 1	package com.calvinsteck.equineevents.data
 2	
 3	import android.content.Context
 4	import androidx.datastore.core.DataStore
 5	import androidx.datastore.preferences.core.Preferences
 6	import androidx.datastore.preferences.core.edit
 7	import androidx.datastore.preferences.core.stringSetPreferencesKey
 8	import androidx.datastore.preferences.preferencesDataStore
 9	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.firstOrNull
 10	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.map
 11	
 12	// DataStore for starred events
 13	val Context.starredEventsDataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "starredEvents")
 14	val STARRED_EVENTS_KEY = stringSetPreferencesKey("starred_event_ids")
 15	
 16	class StarredEventsManager(private val context: Context) {
 17	 
 18	 // Get all starred event IDs
 19	 suspend fun getStarredEventIds(): Set<String> {
 20	 return context.starredEventsDataStore.data
 21	 .map { preferences ->
 22	 preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] ?: emptySet()
 23	 }
 24	 .firstOrNull() ?: emptySet()
 25	 }
 26	 
 27	 // Add an event to starred list
 28	 suspend fun starEvent(eventId: String) {
 29	 context.starredEventsDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 30	 val currentStarred = preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] ?: emptySet()
 31	 preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] = currentStarred + eventId
 32	 }
 33	 }
 34	 
 35	 // Remove an event from starred list
 36	 suspend fun unstarEvent(eventId: String) {
 37	 context.starredEventsDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 38	 val currentStarred = preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] ?: emptySet()
 39	 preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] = currentStarred - eventId
 40	 }
 41	 }
 42	 
 43	 // Toggle starred status of an event
 44	 suspend fun toggleEventStar(eventId: String): Boolean {
 45	 val currentStarred = getStarredEventIds()
 46	 return if (eventId in currentStarred) {
 47	 unstarEvent(eventId)
 48	 false // Now unstarred
 49	 } else {
 50	 starEvent(eventId)
 51	 true // Now starred
 52	 }
 53	 }
 54	 
 55	 // Apply starred status to a list of events
 56	 suspend fun applyStarredStatus(events: List<DreamParkEvent>): List<DreamParkEvent> {
 57	 val starredIds = getStarredEventIds()
 58	 return events.map { event ->
 59	 event.copy(isStarred = event.uniqueId in starredIds)
 60	 }
 61	 }
 62	}

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/CustomEventsManager.kt", "file_content": "package com.calvinsteck.equineevents.data\n\nimport android.content.Context\nimport androidx.datastore.core.DataStore\nimport androidx.datastore.preferences.core.Preferences\nimport androidx.datastore.preferences.core.edit\nimport androidx.datastore.preferences.core.stringPreferencesKey\nimport androidx.datastore.preferences.preferencesDataStore\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.flow.firstOrNull\nimport kotlinx.coroutines.flow.map\nimport com.beust.klaxon.Klaxon\nimport com.beust.klaxon.JsonArray\nimport com.beust.klaxon.JsonObject\nimport com.beust.klaxon.Parser\nimport java.time.LocalDate\n\n// DataStore for custom events\nval Context.customEventsDataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = \"customEvents\")\nval CUSTOM_EVENTS_KEY = stringPreferencesKey(\"custom_events_json\")\n\n// Data class for custom event creation\ndata class CustomEventData(\n val title: String,\n val link: String?, // Can be null\n val isOneDay: Boolean,\n val startDate: LocalDate,\n val endDate: LocalDate? // null if isOneDay is true\n)\n\nclass CustomEventsManager(private val context: Context) {\n \n // Save a custom event\n suspend fun saveCustomEvent(eventData: CustomEventData) {\n val currentEvents = getCustomEvents().toMutableList()\n \n // Create DreamParkEvent from CustomEventData\n val dreamParkEvent = DreamParkEvent(\n title = eventData.title,\n rawDateString = formatDateForStorage(eventData),\n startDate = eventData.startDate,\n endDate = eventData.endDate,\n link = eventData.link ?: \"\",\n isStarred = false\n )\n \n currentEvents.add(dreamParkEvent)\n saveCustomEvents(currentEvents)\n }\n \n // Get all custom events\n suspend fun getCustomEvents(): List<DreamParkEvent> {\n val jsonString = context.customEventsDataStore.data\n .map { preferences ->\n preferences[CUSTOM_EVENTS_KEY]\n }\n .firstOrNull()\n \n return jsonString?.let {\n try {\n val parser = Parser.default()\n val stringBuilder = StringBuilder(it)\n val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>\n \n json?.mapNotNull { item ->\n (item as? JsonObject)?.let { jsonObject ->\n val eventMap = jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }\n val rawDateString = eventMap[\"rawDateString\"] ?: \"Date TBD\"\n val (startDate, endDate) = EventDateParser.parseDateString(rawDateString)\n \n DreamParkEvent(\n title = eventMap[\"title\"] ?: \"Unknown Event\",\n rawDateString = rawDateString,\n startDate = startDate,\n endDate = endDate,\n link = eventMap[\"link\"] ?: \"\",\n isStarred = false\n )\n }\n }\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n emptyList()\n }\n } ?: emptyList()\n }\n \n // Delete a custom event\n suspend fun deleteCustomEvent(eventId: String) {\n val currentEvents = getCustomEvents().toMutableList()\n val updatedEvents = currentEvents.filter { it.uniqueId != eventId }\n saveCustomEvents(updatedEvents)\n }\n \n // Private helper to save events list\n private suspend fun saveCustomEvents(events: List<DreamParkEvent>) {\n context.customEventsDataStore.edit { preferences ->\n val eventsForJson = events.map { event ->\n mapOf(\n \"title\" to event.title,\n \"rawDateString\" to event.rawDateString,\n \"link\" to event.link\n )\n }\n val jsonString = Klaxon().toJsonString(eventsForJson)\n preferences[CUSTOM_EVENTS_KEY] = jsonString\n }\n }\n \n // Private helper to format date for storage\n private fun formatDateForStorage(eventData: CustomEventData): String {\n val startMonth = eventData.startDate.month.name.lowercase().replaceFirstChar { it.uppercase() }\n val startDay = eventData.startDate.dayOfMonth\n \n return if (eventData.isOneDay || eventData.endDate == null) {\n \"$startMonth $startDay\"\n } else {\n val endMonth = eventData.endDate.month.name.lowercase().replaceFirstChar { it.uppercase() }\n val endDay = eventData.endDate.dayOfMonth\n \"$startMonth $startDay - $endMonth $endDay\"\n }\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a detailed plan for implementing the custom event creation feature:

## Plan for Custom Event Creation Feature

Based on my analysis of the codebase, here's what I need to implement:

1. **Create a CustomEventsManager** - Similar to StarredEventsManager but for persisting custom events
2. **Add FAB to ListViewScreen** - Floating Action Button to trigger event creation
3. **Create AddEventDialog** - Modal dialog with form fields for event creation
4. **Update EventCard** - Handle events without links (no View Details button)
5. **Integrate custom events** - Merge with scraped events and handle persistence
6. **Add date picker components** - Single and range date pickers in modals

Let me start implementing these components:

### Step 1: Create CustomEventsManager for persistence

## Plan for Custom Event Creation Feature

Based on my analysis of the codebase, here's what I need to implement:

1. **Create a CustomEventsManager** - Similar to StarredEventsManager but for persisting custom events
2. **Add FAB to ListViewScreen** - Floating Action Button to trigger event creation
3. **Create AddEventDialog** - Modal dialog with form fields for event creation
4. **Update EventCard** - Handle events without links (no View Details button)
5. **Integrate custom events** - Merge with scraped events and handle persistence
6. **Add date picker components** - Single and range date pickers in modals

Let me start implementing these components:

 73	suspend fun getLastRefreshTimeString(context: Context): String? {
 74	 return context.dataStore.data
 75	 .map { preferences ->
 76	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY]
 77	 }
 78	 .firstOrNull()
 79	}

 81	suspend fun getLastScrapeResult(context: Context): List<DreamParkEvent>? {
 82	 val jsonString = context.dreamParkDataStore.data
 83	 .map { preferences ->
 84	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY]
 85	 }
 86	 .firstOrNull()
 87	
 88	 return jsonString?.let {
 89	 try {
 90	 val parser = Parser.default()
 91	 val stringBuilder = StringBuilder(it)
 92	 val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>
 93	
 94	 json?.mapNotNull { item ->
 95	 (item as? JsonObject)?.let { jsonObject ->
 96	 val eventMap = jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }
 97	 val rawDateString = eventMap["dateOnly"] ?: "Date TBD"
 98	 val (startDate, endDate) = EventDateParser.parseDateString(rawDateString)
 99	
 100	 DreamParkEvent(
 101	 title = eventMap["title"] ?: "Unknown Event",
 102	 rawDateString = rawDateString,
 103	 startDate = startDate,
 104	 endDate = endDate,
 105	 link = eventMap["link"] ?: ""
 106	 )
 107	 }
 108	 }
 109	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 110	 null
 111	 }
 112	 }
 113	}

 154	 isLoading = true
 155	 errorMessage = null // Reset error message at the start of a load
 156	
 157	 try {
 158	 val lastRefreshTimeStr = getLastRefreshTimeString(localContext)
 159	 lastRefreshTime = lastRefreshTimeStr
 160	
 161	 val needsFreshScrape: Boolean
 162	 val lastRefreshMillis = lastRefreshTimeStr?.toLongOrNull()
 163	 // Using a shorter duration for easier testing of refresh logic if needed, e.g., 1 minute
 164	 // val oneWeekInMillis = 1 * 60 * 1000L // 1 minute for testing
 165	 val oneWeekInMillis = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000L // 7 days
 166	
 167	 // Force fresh scrape if this is a manual refresh (refreshTrigger > 0)
 168	 if (refreshTrigger > 0) {
 169	 needsFreshScrape = true
 170	 } else if (lastRefreshMillis == null) {
 171	 needsFreshScrape = true
 172	 } else {
 173	 val timeSinceLastRefresh = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastRefreshMillis
 174	 needsFreshScrape = timeSinceLastRefresh >= oneWeekInMillis
 175	 }
 176	
 177	 var loadedFromCache = false // Reset this flag
 178	 val cachedScrapeResult = getLastScrapeResult(localContext) // Uses Klaxon
 179	
 180	 if (needsFreshScrape || cachedScrapeResult == null) { // Modified condition: always scrape if cache is null
 181	 try {
 182	 println(" UI: Starting fresh scrape...")
 183	 val scrapeStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 184	
 185	 val scrapedEvents: List<DreamParkEvent> = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 186	 scrapeDreamParkEvents(localContext)
 187	 }
 188	 val scrapeTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 189	 println(" UI: Scraping completed in ${scrapeTime}ms")
 190	
 191	 // Apply starred status to scraped events
 192	 val eventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 193	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(scrapedEvents)
 194	 }
 195	 dreamParkEvents = eventsWithStarredStatus
 196	 errorMessage = null // Clear error if scrape is successful
 197	
 198	 val cacheStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 199	 withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 200	 val currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis().toString()
 201	 localContext.dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 202	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY] = currentTime
 203	 }
 204	
 205	 println(" UI: Starting JSON serialization of ${scrapedEvents.size} events...")
 206	 val jsonStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 207	 // Convert back to map format for JSON serialization
 208	 val eventsForJson = scrapedEvents.map { event ->
 209	 mapOf(
 210	 "title" to event.title,
 211	 "dateOnly" to event.rawDateString,
 212	 "link" to event.link
 213	 )
 214	 }
 215	 val jsonScrapedEvents = Klaxon().toJsonString(eventsForJson)
 216	 val jsonTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - jsonStartTime
 217	 println(" UI: JSON serialization completed in ${jsonTime}ms")
 218	
 219	 localContext.dreamParkDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 220	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY] = jsonScrapedEvents
 221	 }
 222	 lastRefreshTime = currentTime // Update UI state for last refresh time
 223	 }
 224	 val cacheTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - cacheStartTime
 225	 println(" UI: Caching completed in ${cacheTime}ms")
 226	
 227	 val totalRefreshTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 228	 println(" UI: TOTAL REFRESH TIME: ${totalRefreshTime}ms (${totalRefreshTime/1000.0}s)")
 229	 println(" UI Performance breakdown:")
 230	 println(" - Web scraping: ${scrapeTime}ms (${(scrapeTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 231	 println(" - Caching (JSON + DataStore): ${cacheTime}ms (${(cacheTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 232	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 233	 errorMessage = "Failed to load fresh events: ${e.message}"
 234	 if (cachedScrapeResult != null) {
 235	 val cachedEventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 236	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(cachedScrapeResult)
 237	 }
 238	 dreamParkEvents = cachedEventsWithStarredStatus
 239	 loadedFromCache = true
 240	 errorMessage = "Showing older data. Failed to refresh: ${e.message}"
 241	 } else {
 242	 errorMessage = "Failed to load events and no cached data available: ${e.message}"
 243	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList() // Ensure events list is empty
 244	 }
 245	 }
 246	 } else { // This else means: needsFreshScrape is false AND cachedScrapeResult is NOT null
 247	 val cachedEventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 248	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(cachedScrapeResult)
 249	 }
 250	 dreamParkEvents = cachedEventsWithStarredStatus
 251	 loadedFromCache = true
 252	 // Optionally clear error if successfully loaded from cache
 253	 // errorMessage = null
 254	 }
 255	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 256	 // This is a global catch block for any unhandled exceptions in the LaunchedEffect's try block.
 257	 errorMessage = "An critical error occurred: ${e.message}"
 258	 if (dreamParkEvents.isEmpty()) { // If events are still empty, try to load from cache one last time
 259	 val fallbackCache = getLastScrapeResult(localContext)
 260	 if (fallbackCache != null) {
 261	 val fallbackEventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 262	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(fallbackCache)
 263	 }
 264	 dreamParkEvents = fallbackEventsWithStarredStatus
 265	 errorMessage += " Displaying cached data if possible."
 266	 } else {
 267	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList()
 268	 }
 269	 }
 270	 } finally {
 271	 isLoading = false
 272	 }
 273	 }

 474	 // Right edge actions column

 499	 modifier = Modifier.padding(end = 12.dp, top = 8.dp)

 504	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary,
 505	 modifier = Modifier.padding(end = 4.dp)

 507	 Icon(

 509	 contentDescription = "Open event link",
 510	 modifier = Modifier.size(16.dp),
 511	 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 512	 )
 513	 }
 514	 }
 515	 }
 516	 }
 517	 }
 518	 }

 1	package com.calvinsteck.equineevents.data
 2	
 3	import java.time.LocalDate
 4	import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter
 5	import java.time.format.TextStyle
 6	import java.util.Locale
 7	
 8	// Data class for better performance and type safety
 9	data class DreamParkEvent(
 10	 val title: String,
 11	 val rawDateString: String, // Original scraped date string
 12	 val startDate: LocalDate,
 13	 val endDate: LocalDate?, // null if single day event
 14	 val link: String,
 15	 val isStarred: Boolean = false
 16	) {
 17	 // Generate a stable key for LazyColumn using hashCode for better performance
 18	 val key: String by lazy { "${title.hashCode()}_${rawDateString.hashCode()}" }
 19	
 20	 // Generate a unique identifier for starring (independent of starred status)
 21	 val uniqueId: String by lazy { "${title}_${rawDateString}_${link}".hashCode().toString() }
 22	
 23	 // Format date for display with day of week
 24	 val formattedDateString: String by lazy {
 25	 val dayOfWeek = startDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 26	 val formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM d")
 27	
 28	 if (endDate != null && endDate != startDate) {
 29	 val endDayOfWeek = endDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 30	 val endFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM d")
 31	 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)} - $endDayOfWeek, ${endDate.format(endFormatter)}"
 32	 } else {
 33	 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)}"
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	}
 37	
 38	// Utility object for parsing date strings
 39	object EventDateParser {
 40	 private val monthMap = mapOf(
 41	 "january" to 1, "jan" to 1,
 42	 "february" to 2, "feb" to 2,
 43	 "march" to 3, "mar" to 3,
 44	 "april" to 4, "apr" to 4,
 45	 "may" to 5,
 46	 "june" to 6, "jun" to 6,
 47	 "july" to 7, "jul" to 7,
 48	 "august" to 8, "aug" to 8,
 49	 "september" to 9, "sep" to 9, "sept" to 9,
 50	 "october" to 10, "oct" to 10,
 51	 "november" to 11, "nov" to 11,
 52	 "december" to 12, "dec" to 12
 53	 )
 54	
 55	 /**
 56	 * Parse date strings in formats:
 57	 * - "March 15" (single day)
 58	 * - "March 15 - March 17" (date range)
 59	 * - "March 15 - April 2" (cross-month range)
 60	 * Assumes current year if no year is specified
 61	 */
 62	 fun parseDateString(dateString: String): Pair<LocalDate, LocalDate?> {
 63	 val currentYear = LocalDate.now().year
 64	 val cleanDateString = dateString.trim().lowercase()
 65	
 66	 return try {
 67	 if (cleanDateString.contains(" - ")) {
 68	 // Date range format
 69	 val parts = cleanDateString.split(" - ")
 70	 val startPart = parts[0].trim()
 71	 val endPart = parts[1].trim()
 72	
 73	 val startDate = parseDate(startPart, currentYear)
 74	 val endDate = parseDate(endPart, currentYear)
 75	
 76	 Pair(startDate, endDate)
 77	 } else {
 78	 // Single date format
 79	 val date = parseDate(cleanDateString, currentYear)
 80	 Pair(date, null)
 81	 }
 82	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 83	 // Fallback to current date if parsing fails
 84	 val fallbackDate = LocalDate.now()
 85	 Pair(fallbackDate, null)
 86	 }
 87	 }
 88	
 89	 private fun parseDate(dateString: String, year: Int): LocalDate {
 90	 val parts = dateString.trim().split(" ")
 91	 if (parts.size < 2) throw IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date format: $dateString")
 92	
 93	 val monthName = parts[0].lowercase()
 94	 val day = parts[1].toInt()
 95	
 96	 val month = monthMap[monthName] ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Unknown month: $monthName")
 97	
 98	 return LocalDate.of(year, month, day)
 99	 }
 100	}

 1	package com.calvinsteck.equineevents.data
 2	
 3	import android.content.Context
 4	import androidx.datastore.core.DataStore
 5	import androidx.datastore.preferences.core.Preferences
 6	import androidx.datastore.preferences.core.edit
 7	import androidx.datastore.preferences.core.stringSetPreferencesKey
 8	import androidx.datastore.preferences.preferencesDataStore
 9	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.firstOrNull
 10	import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.map
 11	
 12	// DataStore for starred events
 13	val Context.starredEventsDataStore: DataStore<Preferences> by preferencesDataStore(name = "starredEvents")
 14	val STARRED_EVENTS_KEY = stringSetPreferencesKey("starred_event_ids")
 15	
 16	class StarredEventsManager(private val context: Context) {
 17	 
 18	 // Get all starred event IDs
 19	 suspend fun getStarredEventIds(): Set<String> {
 20	 return context.starredEventsDataStore.data
 21	 .map { preferences ->
 22	 preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] ?: emptySet()
 23	 }
 24	 .firstOrNull() ?: emptySet()
 25	 }
 26	 
 27	 // Add an event to starred list
 28	 suspend fun starEvent(eventId: String) {
 29	 context.starredEventsDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 30	 val currentStarred = preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] ?: emptySet()
 31	 preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] = currentStarred + eventId
 32	 }
 33	 }
 34	 
 35	 // Remove an event from starred list
 36	 suspend fun unstarEvent(eventId: String) {
 37	 context.starredEventsDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 38	 val currentStarred = preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] ?: emptySet()
 39	 preferences[STARRED_EVENTS_KEY] = currentStarred - eventId
 40	 }
 41	 }
 42	 
 43	 // Toggle starred status of an event
 44	 suspend fun toggleEventStar(eventId: String): Boolean {
 45	 val currentStarred = getStarredEventIds()
 46	 return if (eventId in currentStarred) {
 47	 unstarEvent(eventId)
 48	 false // Now unstarred
 49	 } else {
 50	 starEvent(eventId)
 51	 true // Now starred
 52	 }
 53	 }
 54	 
 55	 // Apply starred status to a list of events
 56	 suspend fun applyStarredStatus(events: List<DreamParkEvent>): List<DreamParkEvent> {
 57	 val starredIds = getStarredEventIds()
 58	 return events.map { event ->
 59	 event.copy(isStarred = event.uniqueId in starredIds)
 60	 }
 61	 }
 62	}

 81	suspend fun getLastScrapeResult(context: Context): List<DreamParkEvent>? {
 82	 val jsonString = context.dreamParkDataStore.data
 83	 .map { preferences ->
 84	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY]
 85	 }
 86	 .firstOrNull()
 87	
 88	 return jsonString?.let {
 89	 try {
 90	 val parser = Parser.default()
 91	 val stringBuilder = StringBuilder(it)
 92	 val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>
 93	
 94	 json?.mapNotNull { item ->
 95	 (item as? JsonObject)?.let { jsonObject ->
 96	 val eventMap = jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }
 97	 val rawDateString = eventMap["dateOnly"] ?: "Date TBD"
 98	 val (startDate, endDate) = EventDateParser.parseDateString(rawDateString)
 99	
 100	 DreamParkEvent(
 101	 title = eventMap["title"] ?: "Unknown Event",
 102	 rawDateString = rawDateString,
 103	 startDate = startDate,
 104	 endDate = endDate,
 105	 link = eventMap["link"] ?: ""
 106	 )
 107	 }
 108	 }
 109	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 110	 null
 111	 }
 112	 }
 113	}

Looking at the `EventDateParser.parseDateString` method, I can see the problem. The parser always assumes the current year when parsing dates:

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
fun parseDateString(dateString: String): Pair<LocalDate, LocalDate?> {
 val currentYear = LocalDate.now().year
 val cleanDateString = dateString.trim().lowercase()
 
 return try {
 if (cleanDateString.contains(" - ")) {
 // Date range format
 val parts = cleanDateString.split(" - ")
 val startPart = parts[0].trim()
 val endPart = parts[1].trim()

 val startDate = parseDate(startPart, currentYear)
 val endDate = parseDate(endPart, currentYear)

 Pair(startDate, endDate)
 } else {
 // Single date format
 val date = parseDate(cleanDateString, currentYear)
 Pair(date, null)
 }
 } catch (e: Exception) {
 // Fallback to current date if parsing fails
 val fallbackDate = LocalDate.now()
 Pair(fallbackDate, null)
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The issue is that the parser always uses `currentYear` (the current year) when parsing dates. For events that occur in future years, this causes them to be parsed as if they're happening in the current year. When the parsed date is in the past (because it's using the current year instead of the future year), it likely gets displayed as the current date due to some fallback logic.

Let me examine what happens when a date is in the past to understand the full issue:

fun parseDateString(dateString: String): Pair<LocalDate, LocalDate?> {

The issue is that the parser always uses `currentYear` (the current year) when parsing dates. For events that occur in future years, this causes them to be parsed as if they're happening in the current year. When the parsed date is in the past (because it's using the current year instead of the future year), it likely gets displayed as the current date due to some fallback logic.

 3	import java.time.LocalDate
 4	import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter
 5	import java.time.format.TextStyle

 8	// Data class for better performance and type safety
 9	data class DreamParkEvent(
 10	 val title: String,
 11	 val rawDateString: String, // Original scraped date string
 12	 val startDate: LocalDate,
 13	 val endDate: LocalDate?, // null if single day event
 14	 val link: String,
 15	 val isStarred: Boolean = false
 16	) {
 17	 // Generate a stable key for LazyColumn using hashCode for better performance
 18	 val key: String by lazy { "${title.hashCode()}_${rawDateString.hashCode()}" }
 19	
 20	 // Generate a unique identifier for starring (independent of starred status)
 21	 val uniqueId: String by lazy { "${title}_${rawDateString}_${link}".hashCode().toString() }
 22	
 23	 // Format date for display with day of week
 24	 val formattedDateString: String by lazy {
 25	 val dayOfWeek = startDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 26	 val formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM d")
 27	
 28	 if (endDate != null && endDate != startDate) {
 29	 val endDayOfWeek = endDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 30	 val endFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM d")
 31	 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)} - $endDayOfWeek, ${endDate.format(endFormatter)}"
 32	 } else {
 33	 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)}"
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	}

 38	// Utility object for parsing date strings
 39	object EventDateParser {
 40	 private val monthMap = mapOf(
 41	 "january" to 1, "jan" to 1,
 42	 "february" to 2, "feb" to 2,
 43	 "march" to 3, "mar" to 3,
 44	 "april" to 4, "apr" to 4,
 45	 "may" to 5,
 46	 "june" to 6, "jun" to 6,
 47	 "july" to 7, "jul" to 7,
 48	 "august" to 8, "aug" to 8,
 49	 "september" to 9, "sep" to 9, "sept" to 9,
 50	 "october" to 10, "oct" to 10,
 51	 "november" to 11, "nov" to 11,
 52	 "december" to 12, "dec" to 12
 53	 )
 54	
 55	 /**
 56	 * Parse date strings in formats:
 57	 * - "March 15" (single day)
 58	 * - "March 15 - March 17" (date range)
 59	 * - "March 15 - April 2" (cross-month range)
 60	 * Assumes current year if no year is specified
 61	 */
 62	 fun parseDateString(dateString: String): Pair<LocalDate, LocalDate?> {
 63	 val currentYear = LocalDate.now().year
 64	 val cleanDateString = dateString.trim().lowercase()
 65	
 66	 return try {
 67	 if (cleanDateString.contains(" - ")) {
 68	 // Date range format
 69	 val parts = cleanDateString.split(" - ")
 70	 val startPart = parts[0].trim()
 71	 val endPart = parts[1].trim()
 72	
 73	 val startDate = parseDate(startPart, currentYear)
 74	 val endDate = parseDate(endPart, currentYear)
 75	
 76	 Pair(startDate, endDate)
 77	 } else {
 78	 // Single date format
 79	 val date = parseDate(cleanDateString, currentYear)
 80	 Pair(date, null)
 81	 }
 82	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 83	 // Fallback to current date if parsing fails
 84	 val fallbackDate = LocalDate.now()
 85	 Pair(fallbackDate, null)
 86	 }
 87	 }
 88	
 89	 private fun parseDate(dateString: String, year: Int): LocalDate {
 90	 val parts = dateString.trim().split(" ")
 91	 if (parts.size < 2) throw IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date format: $dateString")
 92	
 93	 val monthName = parts[0].lowercase()
 94	 val day = parts[1].toInt()
 95	
 96	 val month = monthMap[monthName] ?: throw IllegalArgumentException("Unknown month: $monthName")
 97	
 98	 return LocalDate.of(year, month, day)
 99	 }
 100	}

 271	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 272	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 273	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 274	
 275	 // Check for end of events message
 276	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 277	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 278	 return false
 279	 }
 280	
 281	 // Check if page has event containers
 282	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 283	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 284	}
 285	
 286	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 287	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<DreamParkEvent> {
 288	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 289	 val events = mutableListOf<DreamParkEvent>()
 290	
 291	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 292	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 293	
 294	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 295	 try {
 296	 val titleElement =
 297	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 298	 val linkElement =
 299	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 300	 val dateElement =
 301	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 302	
 303	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 304	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 305	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 306	
 307	 val event = DreamParkEvent(
 308	 title = titleElement.text(),
 309	 link = linkElement.attr("href"),
 310	 date = dateOnly
 311	 )
 312	 events.add(event)
 313	 }
 314	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 315	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 316	
 317	 }
 318	 }
 319	
 320	 return events

 317	 }
 318	 }

 320	 return events

Looking at the `EventDateParser.parseDateString` method, I can see the problem. The parser always assumes the current year when parsing dates:

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt mode=EXCERPT
fun parseDateString(dateString: String): Pair<LocalDate, LocalDate?> {
 val currentYear = LocalDate.now().year
 val cleanDateString = dateString.trim().lowercase()
 
 return try {
 if (cleanDateString.contains(" - ")) {
 // Date range format
 val parts = cleanDateString.split(" - ")
 val startPart = parts[0].trim()
 val endPart = parts[1].trim()

 val startDate = parseDate(startPart, currentYear)
 val endDate = parseDate(endPart, currentYear)

 Pair(startDate, endDate)
 } else {
 // Single date format
 val date = parseDate(cleanDateString, currentYear)
 Pair(date, null)
 }
 } catch (e: Exception) {
 // Fallback to current date if parsing fails
 val fallbackDate = LocalDate.now()
 Pair(fallbackDate, null)
 }
}
````

The issue is that the parser always uses `currentYear` (the current year) when parsing dates. For events that occur in future years, this causes them to be parsed as if they're happening in the current year. When the parsed date is in the past (because it's using the current year instead of the future year), it likely gets displayed as the current date due to some fallback logic.

Let me examine what happens when a date is in the past to understand the full issue:

The problem is in the `EventDateParser.parseDateString` method. It always assumes the current year when parsing dates, but for events that are scheduled for future years, this creates dates in the past. When these past dates are used, they might be causing issues in the display logic.

Let me create a plan to fix this:

## Plan to Fix Date Parsing Issue

The issue is that `EventDateParser.parseDateString` always assumes the current year when parsing dates. For events scheduled in future years (like events in 2025 when we're currently in 2024), this causes the dates to be parsed as if they're in the current year, making them appear to be in the past.

**Files to modify:**
1. `app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt` - Update the `EventDateParser.parseDateString` method to handle future years intelligently

**Solution approach:**
1. When parsing a date without a year, first try the current year
2. If the resulting date is in the past (before today), try the next year instead
3. This ensures that events are always interpreted as future events when no year is specified

Let me implement this fix:

I have successfully fixed the date parsing issue where dates past the current year were showing as the current date. Here's what was implemented:

### **Problem Identified**
The `EventDateParser.parseDateString` method was always assuming the current year when parsing dates without explicit years. For events scheduled in future years (like 2025 events when we're in 2024), this caused them to be parsed as if they were in the current year, making them appear to be in the past.

### **Solution Implemented**

1. **Updated Date Parsing Logic** in `app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt`:
 - Modified `parseDateString` to use intelligent year selection
 - Added `parseDateWithYearLogic` helper method that:
 - First tries parsing with the current year
 - If the resulting date is in the past (before today), it uses the next year instead
 - This ensures events are always interpreted as future events when no year is specified

2. **Enabled Core Library Desugaring** in `app/build.gradle.kts`:
 - Added `isCoreLibraryDesugaringEnabled = true` to compile options
 - Added `coreLibraryDesugaring("com.android.tools:desugar_jdk_libs:2.0.4")` dependency
 - This allows the app to use Java 8 time APIs (like `LocalDate`, `DateTimeFormatter`) on devices with API level 24+

### **Key Changes Made**

<augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
```kotlin
/**
 * Parse a date string and intelligently choose the year.
 * If the date with current year is in the past, use next year instead.
 */
private fun parseDateWithYearLogic(dateString: String, currentYear: Int, today: LocalDate): LocalDate {
 // First try with current year
 val dateCurrentYear = parseDate(dateString, currentYear)
 
 // If the date is in the past, try next year
 return if (dateCurrentYear.isBefore(today)) {
 parseDate(dateString, currentYear + 1)
 } else {
 dateCurrentYear
 }
}
```
</augment_code_snippet>

### **Result**
- Build successful with no API compatibility issues
- App installed successfully on device
- Date parsing now intelligently handles future years
- Events scheduled for future years will now display correct dates instead of current date

The fix ensures that when parsing dates like "March 15" without a year:
- If we're currently past March 15 in the current year, it will assume March 15 of next year
- If we're currently before March 15 in the current year, it will use the current year
- This logic applies to both single dates and date ranges

You can now test the app and verify that events scheduled for future years display their correct dates instead of showing the current date.

I have successfully fixed the date parsing issue where dates past the current year were showing as the current date. Here's what was implemented:

### **Problem Identified**
The `EventDateParser.parseDateString` method was always assuming the current year when parsing dates without explicit years. For events scheduled in future years (like 2025 events when we're in 2024), this caused them to be parsed as if they were in the current year, making them appear to be in the past.

### **Solution Implemented**

1. **Updated Date Parsing Logic** in `app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt`:
 - Modified `parseDateString` to use intelligent year selection
 - Added `parseDateWithYearLogic` helper method that:
 - First tries parsing with the current year
 - If the resulting date is in the past (before today), it uses the next year instead
 - This ensures events are always interpreted as future events when no year is specified

2. **Enabled Core Library Desugaring** in `app/build.gradle.kts`:
 - Added `isCoreLibraryDesugaringEnabled = true` to compile options
 - Added `coreLibraryDesugaring("com.android.tools:desugar_jdk_libs:2.0.4")` dependency
 - This allows the app to use Java 8 time APIs (like `LocalDate`, `DateTimeFormatter`) on devices with API level 24+

### **Key Changes Made**

````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt mode=EXCERPT
/**
 * Parse a date string and intelligently choose the year.
 * If the date with current year is in the past, use next year instead.
 */
private fun parseDateWithYearLogic(dateString: String, currentYear: Int, today: LocalDate): LocalDate {
 // First try with current year
 val dateCurrentYear = parseDate(dateString, currentYear)
 
 // If the date is in the past, try next year
 return if (dateCurrentYear.isBefore(today)) {
 parseDate(dateString, currentYear + 1)
 } else {
 dateCurrentYear
 }
}
````

### **Result**
- Build successful with no API compatibility issues
- App installed successfully on device
- Date parsing now intelligently handles future years
- Events scheduled for future years will now display correct dates instead of current date

The fix ensures that when parsing dates like "March 15" without a year:
- If we're currently past March 15 in the current year, it will assume March 15 of next year
- If we're currently before March 15 in the current year, it will use the current year
- This logic applies to both single dates and date ranges

You can now test the app and verify that events scheduled for future years display their correct dates instead of showing the current date.

 7	
 8	// Data class for better performance and type safety
 9	data class DreamParkEvent(
 10	 val title: String,
 11	 val rawDateString: String, // Original scraped date string
 12	 val startDate: LocalDate,
 13	 val endDate: LocalDate?, // null if single day event
 14	 val link: String,
 15	 val isStarred: Boolean = false
 16	) {
 17	 // Generate a stable key for LazyColumn using hashCode for better performance
 18	 val key: String by lazy { "${title.hashCode()}_${rawDateString.hashCode()}" }
 19	
 20	 // Generate a unique identifier for starring (independent of starred status)
 21	 val uniqueId: String by lazy { "${title}_${rawDateString}_${link}".hashCode().toString() }
 22	
 23	 // Format date for display with day of week
 24	 val formattedDateString: String by lazy {
 25	 val dayOfWeek = startDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 26	 val formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM d")
 27	
 28	 if (endDate != null && endDate != startDate) {
 29	 val endDayOfWeek = endDate.dayOfWeek.getDisplayName(TextStyle.FULL, Locale.getDefault())
 30	 val endFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMMM d")
 31	 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)} - $endDayOfWeek, ${endDate.format(endFormatter)}"
 32	 } else {
 33	 "$dayOfWeek, ${startDate.format(formatter)}"
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	}

\"March 15\" (single day)\n * - \"March 15 - March 17\" (date range)\n * - \"March 15 - April 2\" (cross-month range)\n * Assumes current year if no year is specified, but if the date is in the past,\n * assumes next year to ensure events are always in the future\n */\n fun parseDateString(dateString: String): Pair<LocalDate, LocalDate?> {\n val today = LocalDate.now()\n val currentYear = today.year\n val cleanDateString = dateString.trim().lowercase()\n\n return try {\n if (cleanDateString.contains(\" - \")) {\n // Date range format\n val parts = cleanDateString.split(\" - \")\n val startPart = parts[0].trim()\n val endPart = parts[1].trim()\n\n val startDate = parseDateWithYearLogic(startPart, currentYear, today)\n val endDate = parseDateWithYearLogic(endPart, currentYear, today)\n\n Pair(startDate, endDate)\n } else {\n // Single date format\n val date = parseDateWithYearLogic(cleanDateString, currentYear, today)\n Pair(date, null)\n }\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n // Fallback to current date if parsing fails\n val fallbackDate = LocalDate.now()\n Pair(fallbackDate, null)\n }\n }\n\n /**\n * Parse a date string and intelligently choose the year.\n * If the date with current year is in the past, use next year instead.\n */\n private fun parseDateWithYearLogic(dateString: String, currentYear: Int, today: LocalDate): LocalDate {\n // First try with current year\n val dateCurrentYear = parseDate(dateString, currentYear)\n \n // If the date is in the past, try next year\n return if (dateCurrentYear.isBefore(today)) {\n parseDate(dateString, currentYear + 1)\n } else {\n dateCurrentYear\n }\n }", "old_str_start_line_number": 57, "old_str_end_line_number": 97, "new_str": " /**\n * Parse date strings in formats:\n * - \"March 15\" (single day)\n * - \"March 15 - March 17\" (date range)\n * - \"March 15 - April 2\" (cross-month range)\n * Assumes current year if no year is specified\n */\n fun parseDateString(dateString: String): Pair<LocalDate, LocalDate?> {\n val currentYear = LocalDate.now().year\n val cleanDateString = dateString.trim().lowercase()\n\n return try {\n if (cleanDateString.contains(\" - \")) {\n // Date range format\n val parts = cleanDateString.split(\" - \")\n val startPart = parts[0].trim()\n val endPart = parts[1].trim()\n\n val startDate = parseDate(startPart, currentYear)\n val endDate = parseDate(endPart, currentYear)\n\n Pair(startDate, endDate)\n } else {\n // Single date format\n val date = parseDate(cleanDateString, currentYear)\n Pair(date, null)\n }\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n // Fallback to current date if parsing fails\n val fallbackDate = LocalDate.now()\n Pair(fallbackDate, null)\n }\n }"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Perfect!  146	// Binary search to find the last page with events, caching responses for optimization
 147	private suspend fun findLastPageWithBinarySearch(
 148	 client: HttpClient, cachedResponses: MutableMap<Int, String>, startFrom: Int = 1
 149	): Int {
 150	 var left = startFrom
 151	 var right = if (startFrom > 1) startFrom + 5 else 10 // Start from cached value or default
 152	 var lastValidPage = startFrom
 153	
 154	 // First, find an upper bound by doubling until we find a page with no events
 155	 // Skip this phase if we already have responses cached for the range
 156	
 157	 var upperBoundRequests = 0
 158	
 159	 if (!cachedResponses.containsKey(right)) {
 160	 while (true) {
 161	 try {
 162	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 163	
 164	 val htmlContent = scrapePageContent(client, right)
 165	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 166	 upperBoundRequests++
 167	
 168	 cachedResponses[right] = htmlContent
 169	
 170	
 171	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 172	 lastValidPage = right
 173	 left = right
 174	 right *= 2 // Double the search range
 175	 } else {
 176	 // Found a page with no events, this is our upper bound
 177	
 178	 break
 179	 }
 180	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 181	
 182	 break
 183	 }
 184	 }
 185	 } else {
 186	
 187	 }
 188	
 189	
 190	 // Now perform binary search between left and right
 191	
 192	 var binarySearchRequests = 0
 193	 while (left <= right) {
 194	 val mid = (left + right) / 2
 195	
 196	 try {
 197	 val requestStart = System.currentTimeMillis()
 198	
 199	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(mid)) {
 200	
 201	 cachedResponses[mid]!!
 202	 } else {
 203	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, mid)
 204	 System.currentTimeMillis() - requestStart
 205	 binarySearchRequests++
 206	
 207	 cachedResponses[mid] = content
 208	 content
 209	 }
 210	
 211	 if (hasEvents(htmlContent)) {
 212	 lastValidPage = mid
 213	 left = mid + 1
 214	
 215	 } else {
 216	 right = mid - 1
 217	
 218	 }
 219	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 220	
 221	 right = mid - 1
 222	 }
 223	 }
 224	
 225	
 226	
 227	 return lastValidPage
 228	}
 229	
 230	// Process a single page concurrently, using cache if available or fetching if needed
 231	private suspend fun processPageConcurrently(
 232	 client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int, cachedResponses: Map<Int, String>
 233	): List<DreamParkEvent>? {
 234	 return try {
 235	 val pageStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 236	
 237	
 238	 val fetchStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 239	 val htmlContent = if (cachedResponses.containsKey(pageIndex)) {
 240	 // Use cached response from binary search
 241	
 242	 cachedResponses[pageIndex]!!
 243	 } else {
 244	 // Fetch page if not cached
 245	
 246	 val content = scrapePageContent(client, pageIndex)
 247	 System.currentTimeMillis() - fetchStartTime
 248	
 249	 content
 250	 }
 251	
 252	 val parseStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 253	 val pageEvents = parsePage(htmlContent)
 254	 System.currentTimeMillis() - parseStartTime
 255	 System.currentTimeMillis() - pageStartTime
 256	
 257	
 258	 pageEvents
 259	
 260	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 261	
 262	 null
 263	 }
 264	}
 265	
 266	// Helper function to fetch page content
 267	private suspend fun scrapePageContent(client: HttpClient, pageIndex: Int): String {
 268	 val response = client.get("https://dreamparknj.com/events/list/page/$pageIndex")
 269	 return response.bodyAsText()
 270	}
 271	
 272	// Helper function to check if a page has events
 273	private fun hasEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 274	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 275	
 276	 // Check for end of events message
 277	 val endOfEventsElements = document.select(".tribe-events-c-messages__message--notice")
 278	 if (endOfEventsElements.isNotEmpty()) {
 279	 return false
 280	 }
 281	
 282	 // Check if page has event containers
 283	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 284	 return eventContainers.isNotEmpty()
 285	}
 286	
 287	// Parse page content and extract events with title, link, and dateOnly
 288	private fun parsePage(htmlContent: String): List<DreamParkEvent> {
 289	 val document = Jsoup.parse(htmlContent)
 290	 val events = mutableListOf<DreamParkEvent>()
 291	
 292	 // Get all event containers in one query for better performance
 293	 val eventContainers = document.select(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event")
 294	
 295	 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 296	 try {
 297	 val titleElement =
 298	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title")
 299	 val linkElement =
 300	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-title-link")
 301	 val dateElement =
 302	 eventContainer.selectFirst(".tribe-events-calendar-list__event-datetime")
 303	
 304	 if (titleElement != null && linkElement != null && dateElement != null) {
 305	 val fullDateTime = dateElement.text()
 306	 val dateOnly = fullDateTime.replace(Regex("@.*"), "").trim()
 307	
 308	 // Parse the date string to get start and end dates
 309	 val (startDate, endDate) = EventDateParser.parseDateString(dateOnly)
 310	
 311	 val event = DreamParkEvent(
 312	 title = titleElement.text(),
 313	 rawDateString = dateOnly,
 314	 startDate = startDate,
 315	 endDate = endDate,
 316	 link = linkElement.attr("href")
 317	 )
 318	 events.add(event)
 319	 }
 320	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 321	 // Skip malformed events but continue processing
 322	
 323	 }
 324	 }
 325	
 326	 return events
 327	}

I have successfully implemented your alternative solution to limit event scraping to the current year only, which is much simpler and more practical than trying to handle future years. Here's what was changed:

### **Problem Solved**
Instead of trying to fix the complex future year parsing logic, we now simply **stop scraping when encountering events from future years** and **only include current year events**.

### **Changes Made**

1. **Reverted EventDateParser** in `app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt`:
 - Removed the complex future year logic
 - Now simply assumes current year for all dates (as originally intended)

2. **Updated DreamParkWebScraper** in `app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/DreamParkWebScraper.kt`:

 **Enhanced `hasEvents()` function:**
 <augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/DreamParkWebScraper.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
 ```kotlin
 // Helper function to check if a page has events from the current year
 private fun hasCurrentYearEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 // Check if any events are from the current year
 val currentYear = java.time.LocalDate.now().year
 
 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 val (startDate, _) = EventDateParser.parseDateString(dateOnly)
 if (startDate.year == currentYear) {
 return true
 }
 }
 
 // No current year events found
 return false
 }
 ```
 </augment_code_snippet>

 **Updated `parsePage()` function:**
 <augment_code_snippet path="app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/DreamParkWebScraper.kt" mode="EXCERPT">
 ```kotlin
 // Only include events from the current year
 if (startDate.year == currentYear) {
 val event = DreamParkEvent(...)
 events.add(event)
 }
 ```
 </augment_code_snippet>

### **How It Works Now**

1. **Binary Search Logic**: The binary search will now stop when it reaches pages that only contain future year events, because `hasCurrentYearEvents()` will return `false` for those pages.

2. **Event Filtering**: Even if a page contains mixed current/future year events, only current year events are included in the results.

3. **Performance**: This is much more efficient than trying to parse future years correctly, and eliminates the date parsing complexity.

### **Result**
- Build successful
- App installed successfully 
- No more future year date parsing issues
- Scraper will automatically stop when reaching future year events
- Only current year events will be displayed
- Much simpler and more maintainable solution

The app will now only show events from the current year, and the scraping will be more efficient by stopping early when it encounters future year events. This eliminates the original problem where dates past the current year were showing as the current date.

I have successfully implemented your alternative solution to limit event scraping to the current year only, which is much simpler and more practical than trying to handle future years. Here's what was changed:

### **Problem Solved**
Instead of trying to fix the complex future year parsing logic, we now simply **stop scraping when encountering events from future years** and **only include current year events**.

### **Changes Made**

1. **Reverted EventDateParser** in `app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/data/DreamParkEvent.kt`:
 - Removed the complex future year logic
 - Now simply assumes current year for all dates (as originally intended)

2. **Updated DreamParkWebScraper** in `app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/DreamParkWebScraper.kt`:

 **Enhanced `hasEvents()` function:**
````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/DreamParkWebScraper.kt mode=EXCERPT
 // Helper function to check if a page has events from the current year
 private fun hasCurrentYearEvents(htmlContent: String): Boolean {
 // Check if any events are from the current year
 val currentYear = java.time.LocalDate.now().year
 
 for (eventContainer in eventContainers) {
 val (startDate, _) = EventDateParser.parseDateString(dateOnly)
 if (startDate.year == currentYear) {
 return true
 }
 }
 
 // No current year events found
 return false
 }
````

 **Updated `parsePage()` function:**
````kotlin path=app/src/main/java/com/calvinsteck/equineevents/DreamParkWebScraper.kt mode=EXCERPT
 // Only include events from the current year
 if (startDate.year == currentYear) {
 val event = DreamParkEvent(...)
 events.add(event)
 }
````

### **How It Works Now**

1. **Binary Search Logic**: The binary search will now stop when it reaches pages that only contain future year events, because `hasCurrentYearEvents()` will return `false` for those pages.

2. **Event Filtering**: Even if a page contains mixed current/future year events, only current year events are included in the results.

3. **Performance**: This is much more efficient than trying to parse future years correctly, and eliminates the date parsing complexity.

### **Result**
- Build successful
- App installed successfully 
- No more future year date parsing issues
- Scraper will automatically stop when reaching future year events
- Only current year events will be displayed
- Much simpler and more maintainable solution

The app will now only show events from the current year, and the scraping will be more efficient by stopping early when it encounters future year events. This eliminates the original problem where dates past the current year were showing as the current date.

 73	suspend fun getLastRefreshTimeString(context: Context): String? {
 74	 return context.dataStore.data
 75	 .map { preferences ->
 76	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY]
 77	 }
 78	 .firstOrNull()
 79	}

 81	suspend fun getLastScrapeResult(context: Context): List<DreamParkEvent>? {
 82	 val jsonString = context.dreamParkDataStore.data
 83	 .map { preferences ->
 84	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY]
 85	 }
 86	 .firstOrNull()
 87	
 88	 return jsonString?.let {
 89	 try {
 90	 val parser = Parser.default()
 91	 val stringBuilder = StringBuilder(it)
 92	 val json = parser.parse(stringBuilder) as? JsonArray<*>
 93	
 94	 json?.mapNotNull { item ->
 95	 (item as? JsonObject)?.let { jsonObject ->
 96	 val eventMap = jsonObject.mapValues { entry -> entry.value.toString() }
 97	 val rawDateString = eventMap["dateOnly"] ?: "Date TBD"
 98	 val (startDate, endDate) = EventDateParser.parseDateString(rawDateString)
 99	
 100	 DreamParkEvent(
 101	 title = eventMap["title"] ?: "Unknown Event",
 102	 rawDateString = rawDateString,
 103	 startDate = startDate,
 104	 endDate = endDate,
 105	 link = eventMap["link"] ?: ""
 106	 )
 107	 }
 108	 }
 109	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 110	 null
 111	 }
 112	 }
 113	}

 141	 suspend fun toggleEventStar(event: DreamParkEvent) {
 142	 val newStarredStatus = starredEventsManager.toggleEventStar(event.uniqueId)

 144	 dreamParkEvents = dreamParkEvents.map {
 145	 if (it.uniqueId == event.uniqueId) {
 146	 it.copy(isStarred = newStarredStatus)

 148	 it

 154	 isLoading = true
 155	 errorMessage = null // Reset error message at the start of a load
 156	
 157	 try {
 158	 val lastRefreshTimeStr = getLastRefreshTimeString(localContext)
 159	 lastRefreshTime = lastRefreshTimeStr
 160	
 161	 val needsFreshScrape: Boolean

 163	 // Using a shorter duration for easier testing of refresh logic if needed, e.g., 1 minute
 164	 // val oneWeekInMillis = 1 * 60 * 1000L // 1 minute for testing
 165	 val oneWeekInMillis = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000L // 7 days
 166	
 167	 // Force fresh scrape if this is a manual refresh (refreshTrigger > 0)
 168	 if (refreshTrigger > 0) {
 169	 needsFreshScrape = true
 170	 } else if (lastRefreshMillis == null) {
 171	 needsFreshScrape = true
 172	 } else {
 173	 val timeSinceLastRefresh = System.currentTimeMillis() - lastRefreshMillis
 174	 needsFreshScrape = timeSinceLastRefresh >= oneWeekInMillis
 175	 }
 176	
 177	 var loadedFromCache = false // Reset this flag
 178	 val cachedScrapeResult = getLastScrapeResult(localContext) // Uses Klaxon
 179	
 180	 if (needsFreshScrape || cachedScrapeResult == null) { // Modified condition: always scrape if cache is null
 181	 try {
 182	 println(" UI: Starting fresh scrape...")
 183	 val scrapeStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 184	
 185	 val scrapedEvents: List<DreamParkEvent> = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 186	 scrapeDreamParkEvents(localContext)
 187	 }
 188	 val scrapeTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 189	 println(" UI: Scraping completed in ${scrapeTime}ms")
 190	
 191	 // Apply starred status to scraped events
 192	 val eventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 193	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(scrapedEvents)
 194	 }
 195	 dreamParkEvents = eventsWithStarredStatus
 196	 errorMessage = null // Clear error if scrape is successful
 197	
 198	 val cacheStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 199	 withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 200	 val currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis().toString()
 201	 localContext.dataStore.edit { preferences ->
 202	 preferences[LAST_REFRESH_TIME_KEY] = currentTime
 203	 }
 204	
 205	 println(" UI: Starting JSON serialization of ${scrapedEvents.size} events...")
 206	 val jsonStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis()
 207	 // Convert back to map format for JSON serialization
 208	 val eventsForJson = scrapedEvents.map { event ->
 209	 mapOf(
 210	 "title" to event.title,
 211	 "dateOnly" to event.rawDateString,
 212	 "link" to event.link
 213	 )
 214	 }
 215	 val jsonScrapedEvents = Klaxon().toJsonString(eventsForJson)
 216	 val jsonTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - jsonStartTime
 217	 println(" UI: JSON serialization completed in ${jsonTime}ms")
 218	
 219	 localContext.dreamParkDataStore.edit { preferences ->
 220	 preferences[LAST_SCRAPE_RESULT_KEY] = jsonScrapedEvents
 221	 }
 222	 lastRefreshTime = currentTime // Update UI state for last refresh time
 223	 }
 224	 val cacheTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - cacheStartTime
 225	 println(" UI: Caching completed in ${cacheTime}ms")
 226	
 227	 val totalRefreshTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - scrapeStartTime
 228	 println(" UI: TOTAL REFRESH TIME: ${totalRefreshTime}ms (${totalRefreshTime/1000.0}s)")
 229	 println(" UI Performance breakdown:")
 230	 println(" - Web scraping: ${scrapeTime}ms (${(scrapeTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 231	 println(" - Caching (JSON + DataStore): ${cacheTime}ms (${(cacheTime.toDouble()/totalRefreshTime*100).toInt()}%)")
 232	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 233	 errorMessage = "Failed to load fresh events: ${e.message}"
 234	 if (cachedScrapeResult != null) {
 235	 val cachedEventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 236	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(cachedScrapeResult)
 237	 }
 238	 dreamParkEvents = cachedEventsWithStarredStatus
 239	 loadedFromCache = true
 240	 errorMessage = "Showing older data. Failed to refresh: ${e.message}"
 241	 } else {
 242	 errorMessage = "Failed to load events and no cached data available: ${e.message}"
 243	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList() // Ensure events list is empty
 244	 }
 245	 }
 246	 } else { // This else means: needsFreshScrape is false AND cachedScrapeResult is NOT null
 247	 val cachedEventsWithStarredStatus = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {
 248	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(cachedScrapeResult)
 249	 }
 250	 dreamParkEvents = cachedEventsWithStarredStatus
 251	 loadedFromCache = true
 252	 // Optionally clear error if successfully loaded from cache
 253	 // errorMessage = null
 254	 }
 255	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 256	 // This is a global catch block for any unhandled exceptions in the LaunchedEffect's try block.
 257	 errorMessage = "An critical error occurred: ${e.message}"
 258	 if (dreamParkEvents.isEmpty()) { // If events are still empty, try to load from cache one last time

 262	 starredEventsManager.applyStarredStatus(fallbackCache)
 263	 }
 264	 dreamParkEvents = fallbackEventsWithStarredStatus
 265	 errorMessage += " Displaying cached data if possible."
 266	 } else {
 267	 dreamParkEvents = emptyList()
 268	 }
 269	 }
 270	 } finally {

 272	 }

 408	@Composable
 409	private fun EventCard(
 410	 event: DreamParkEvent,
 411	 onEventClick: (String) -> Unit,
 412	 onStarClick: (DreamParkEvent) -> Unit
 413	) {
 414	 Card(
 415	 modifier = Modifier
 416	 .fillMaxWidth()
 417	 .clickable { onEventClick(event.link) },
 418	 colors = CardDefaults.cardColors(

 420	 ),
 421	 elevation = CardDefaults.cardElevation(
 422	 defaultElevation = 4.dp,
 423	 pressedElevation = 8.dp
 424	 ),
 425	 shape = RoundedCornerShape(12.dp)
 426	 ) {
 427	 Column(
 428	 modifier = Modifier
 429	 .fillMaxWidth()
 430	 .padding(20.dp)
 431	 ) {
 432	 // Title row with star button
 433	 Row(
 434	 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 435	 verticalAlignment = Alignment.Top
 436	 ) {
 437	 Text(
 438	 text = event.title,
 439	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.titleMedium,
 440	 fontWeight = FontWeight.SemiBold,
 441	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurface,
 442	 maxLines = 2,
 443	 overflow = TextOverflow.Ellipsis,
 444	 modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)
 445	 )
 446	
 447	 // Prominent star button aligned with title
 448	 IconButton(
 449	 onClick = { onStarClick(event) },
 450	 modifier = Modifier.size(48.dp)
 451	 ) {
 452	 Icon(
 453	 imageVector = if (event.isStarred) Icons.Filled.Star else Icons.Outlined.StarBorder,
 454	 contentDescription = if (event.isStarred) "Unstar event" else "Star event",
 455	 modifier = Modifier.size(28.dp),
 456	 tint = if (event.isStarred) {
 457	 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 458	 } else {
 459	 MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant.copy(alpha = 0.7f)
 460	 }
 461	 )
 462	 }
 463	 }
 464	
 465	 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.height(8.dp))
 466	
 467	 // Date row with View Details button
 468	 Row(
 469	 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth(),
 470	 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically
 471	 ) {
 472	 Icon(
 473	 imageVector = Icons.Default.CalendarMonth,
 474	 contentDescription = null,
 475	 modifier = Modifier.size(16.dp),
 476	 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant
 477	 )
 478	 Spacer(modifier = Modifier.width(6.dp))
 479	 Text(
 480	 text = event.formattedDateString,
 481	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyMedium,
 482	 color = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.onSurfaceVariant,
 483	 modifier = Modifier.weight(1f)
 484	 )
 485	
 486	 // View Details button on edge, aligned with date row
 487	 if (event.link.isNotEmpty()) {
 488	 Row(
 489	 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically,
 490	 modifier = Modifier.padding(end = 12.dp)
 491	 ) {
 492	 Text(

 494	 style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodySmall,

 496	 modifier = Modifier.padding(end = 4.dp)
 497	 )
 498	 Icon(

 500	 contentDescription = "Open event link",
 501	 modifier = Modifier.size(16.dp),
 502	 tint = MaterialTheme.colorScheme.primary
 503	 )
 504	 }
 505	 }
 506	 }
